description: It can take some time to get your order, but always worth it. I find it very difficult to walk by and not stop in and get a mocha to go. If you decide to stay they have some of the cheapest beer prices.
author: Kari E.

description:
Columbus Cafe is probably a tourist trap but `at least they deliver excellent breakfast sandwiches. When I like to indulge on my cheat days (Just kidding, everyday is a cheat day for me because breakfast is my favorite meal of the day) I go to Columbus and order myself a croissant sandwich and an ice cold chai latte. Who am I kidding, I go here on my lazy mornings because I dread doing dishes from making breakfast because when I make breakfast, I go hard. I should open up a brunch spot for aggressive brunchers cause I make a mean breakfast!

When I first had their chai latte, I was immediately impressed. I had it in house and it was beautifully frothy, creamy, and super decadent for chai. They probably used whole milk the first time which it probably why I was so enamored. 

The second time I ordered chai to go and literally the barrista poured milk into a cup and then some pre-made shelf stable chai mix that you can get from the grocery store. Charging patrons $4 for this seems excessive in my opinion because it's little to zero effort or artistry.

Freaking Lombard and it's tourist prices!
author: Connie M.

description:
Surprising that the north end of Columbus is so devoid of places to hang out or get a drink. Just four or five blocks over toward downtown there are dozens of bars and restaurants buzzing with action.  But not near 901. 

So, 901 is the best of not much. Imagine a bar that crashed into a market / deli and then got halfway through a remodel to make it a coffee shop before stopping in full mash up mode. It's like a pocket knife with tools for a range of purposes but not one done really super well. 

They have 2-3 tables in front where you can sit in warm weather, but even that is pretty underwhelming. 

Fine in a pinch, but pinch yourself to search a little wider and you'll do better.
author: Lanny B.

description: This place is awful. The bagel doesn't even have any cream cheese on it. It was stale. Basically a stale bagel with thick slices of cucumber on it. Disgusting. And they have terrible service. I am shocked to see this place has a four star rating.
author: Beckie H.

description: I had the best BLT with mayo at 901. It was honestly the perfect sandwich. It has a super cute neighborhood vibes.
author: Tina L.

description:
I just bought a panini.  I have been sitting here for about an hour.  It is not busy.  There are only two employees, both of whom have interacted with me.  One of them just tried to stop me from using the restroom stating (as the posted signs do) that the restrooms are for customers.  I told him I was one and stated I bought a sandwich and pointed to where he had seen me sitting for the past hour.  He didn't believe me and had to check with the other employee (speaking in Spanish presumably so I wouldn't hear what they said) before allowing me to finally use the restroom.  I have no idea why he stopped me, but I do know he didn't harass a less flamboyant man who went to the restroom before he left. Don't sell food or drinks if you won't let paying customers pee and you insist on treating them like criminals.  This was my second time here.  I won't be back.

After I used the restroom I went to the other employee to complain about how I was treated.  He laughed it off, literally laughing at me to my face, and the rude employee kept speaking over me.  Only go here if you have a catheter or colostomy bag and enjoy rude service and mediocre food.
author: Clarke F.

description: Good coffee and pastries !  Friendly service although there was only one person helping at the counter.  Great spot for morning coffee!
author: Basem T.

description: I ordered the Crunchy Tuna sandwich on a panini. It was pretty big, delicious and filling. The place had a cool ambiance and was really clean. The staff was very friendly and patient with us as we looked on the menu trying to decide what to eat. The reason I'm giving it 4 stars is because I don't think it's reasonably priced, it was pretty overpriced. I'm from NYC so I know overpriced, but this seemed over the top. $10 for a panini ? I guess that's San Francisco for you.
author: Janice D.

description:
Looking around for something to eat and came across this cafe. At first glance was hesitant because the menu is overwhelming. My wife and I contemplated on what to order and the server was patient with us. I ordered the turkey club and she ordered the crunchy tuna sandwich. We were told if we wanted to make it a panini it would cost an additional $1. The paninis were surprisingly a decent size and actual quite fulfilling. 

I ordered the iced tea and their weren't refills. Refills were only for the coffee. This was my only negative comment about this place. The most you'd pay for anything is $10.50

Great location.
author: George D.

description:
Remarkably mediocre food. Usually at this price point and in a larger cafe, their pastries (bagels, croissants) are ordered from a bakery on a daily basis. Here they're ordered from a chain grocery store and kept frozen. Eggs were tastelessly prepared, bacon was atrocious, and egg bacon bagel sandwich doesn't even come with cream cheese so it's as dry as can be.

In short, only eat here if you have to.
author: Theo M.

description: MMMMMMMM!! Delicious, fresh food and amazing coffee!! My son had the panini and said it was the best he ever had! The smoothies were also excellent. Love the personal vibe inside, art for sale in the walls and books to read on the shelves. Exactly the type of place we were looking for this morning!! Thank you for the excellent food and customer service!!!!
author: Kristie B.

description: I've lived in the neighborhood for 11 years. The 901 was always been one of my favorite spots. They have an amazing B.L.T.M. and chai latte. I've never had a bad experience here. The staff is great, the service is fast, and they always play the local sports games. I will continue to come here for as long as I'm in the city. I would highly recommend the 901 to anyone in this area.
author: Brittany B.

description: I'm not sure how this place received 4 or more stars.  The ambience was missing tables was old and dirty.  But my waffles was good and a lot more than I wanted to spend.  I ordered the house coffee it was eh, watered down and probably sitting for awhile.  We ate there but charged me for $1 for a second cup?  really?  Staff could be friendlier
author: Lanie B.

description: it's a good place to stop for a $3 beer. Especially if you just walked up to the top of Lombard St.
author: David F.

description: The employees here are really rude. I was ready to grab a tea and kill an hour before meeting the rest of my party for a show at Cobb's. But I don't patronize businesses with rude employees. So I left after interacting with the guy at the counter tonight. (Just as well - it was pretty grungy and generic, anyway.)
author: H.E. O.

description:
I'd go with 3.5 if that was a choice. Very relaxed environment and a very large menu but by 11 am on a Sunday they were out of many types of bagels and it seemed the clientele had to ask for secondary options several times. 

They were super polite to customers who were visiting internationally and didn't speak perfect English though. 

Also not as cheap as a true local option would be. Food was ready fast at least. 

Drink selections (alcoholic, non-alcoholic, shakes, sodas, energy drinks, juices, odwallas, etc was massive.
author: David A.

description:
Came here to have a few beers before heading to the comedy club next door.

$2.50 draft beers are a awesome price. They serve food as well but just had drinks here.

Seating is low key and staff is alright.
author: Sal M.

description:
901 Columbus Cafe, I don't know if it's  considered a best kept secret around here or not but it's definitely a saving grace for the hungry and thirsty person doing a walking tour around San Francisco. Why? Okay, I'll elaborate.

From the outside this place really doesn't look much different than your typical, space-restricted SF cafe except for one thing; a sign that says it has $2 pints everyday.  That's right, $2 pints of beer on draft.  For a place in SF it would probably be acceptable even if it was $2 for some domestic trash beer, but it isn't.   It was like a tractor beam that pulled me in.  

The $2 beers (at the time) were a choice of  SF's own, Speakeasy Brewing's Big Daddy IPA, Prohibition Ale and Tallulah Extra Pale Ale.  Sure, they might not get an average rating of 4 or higher on BeerAdvocate but at $2 for a pint of craft beer...in SF...on a Saturday, are your really going to argue? I didn't think so.

So aside from the $2 beers and some pretty cheap bottled offerings, they also make sandwiches, pastries, coffee and other breakfast options here for affordable prices to really round out their function as a cafe.  However, based upon what you've read already, you know what I was here for.  I had to grab a cold one before trekking up to the top of Lombard Street.

There's still ample seating bot inside and out despite the size of the cafe, which in reality, is pretty decent in size. It isn't the most modern, upscale cafe you'll probably visit in the SF area but the fact of the matter is that it serves it purpose quite well.  Beer, food, wifi, you really can't go wrong here.

If I found myself walking around SF on any given day and I wanted to grab a few cold beers without breaking the bank, this place can easily be my regular spot.  Easily.
author: Jeff S.

description: Came here with my family after we concluded our walking tour of the famous Lombard Street. This place fulfilled all of our picky food desires! I got the Maui Smoothie and a Hummus sandwich, both were exceptional. San Francisco has some delicious eateries, and the 901 Columbus Cafe fits the bill. The service was impressively fast and we were all very happy.
author: Michael N.

description:
Perfect place!
We stopped here for breakfast on the way from Lombard street to coit tower, and came back on our last day here.
The food and coffee are amazingly delicious, high quality and fresh ingredients!
Super recommended!
author: Yarin D.

description:
Cute little cafe with good drinks (hot & cold) and their chicken sandwich was excellent! The owners seem to be very involved and keep things clean and running smoothly. We love to get some work done here on the weekends.

If you're looking for a nice corner cafe to work, eat and have coffee, then this is the right place to be!
author: Nadia S.

description: Small and nice coffee shop in one of the most touristy parts of SF. They have a variety of breakfast items, coffees and smoothies. I went with the salmon bagel and it was great, my bf had the breakfast burrito and said it was okay. The only downside is that the service is a bit slow and they only take cash.
author: Yéva M.

description:
Stopped in here for lunch as I had seen on Yelp they do soup and that's what I was in the mood for! $4.50 for a cup as I thought a bowl would be too much for me, however I think they gave me a bowl anyway! Tomato ravioli with delicious bread and iced water on tap.
The menu looks great and the decor was cool. Not loads of places to sit - many people came in and left because there were no free seats!
Will definitely return here
author: Ellie B.

description: I always seem to find myself stopping here while walking around North Beach on a nice day. I was initially enticed by the $2.50 draft beer sign and outdoor seating. This little cafe has a nice selection of wraps, salads, sandwiches, coffee and pastries. I've tried the falafel wrap, nice and spicy and quite filling with a small side salad. The $2.50 beers offered are all from Speakeasy Ales so you're not just getting some cheap PBR. Also, I think glasses of wine are around $3. Nothing fancy here just a great affordable place in the area to grab a bite and enjoy the outside.
author: Kelsey B.

description: Great selection of sandwiches and waffles. Also great coffee drinks. I had the El Granada sand which, it had spicy salami, fresh mozzarella and a pesto sauce on sourdough. It was fantastic. They only take cash but otherwise great inexpensive place for good solid food while walking around the city.
author: David M.

description:
OMG thank you 901 Columbus Cafe for saving my tummy from what seemed like eternal starvation! Originally, we'd decided on some sourdough at Boudin, but when we were told we'd have to wait 45 minutes, we thought "nevermind!"

So off we go in search of another place. Walking... more walking ... baby screaming ... hurry up and find a place ... oh look that place says $2 drafts ... let me check with Yelp first ... Yelp says OK! ... Let's go! 

We walk up to the counter and place our order. The guy at the counter recommended the wise guy panini, so I went ahead and tried that. The panini was ABSOLUTELY delicious. I loved the large slices of mozzarella! Soooo good! My husband had the pastrami and wasn't too happy with it. He kept complaining about a weird taste, then he took out the lettuce and said that it was the culprit. Needless to say, I felt kinda bad that his meal wasn't as great as mine. 

And YEP, $2 drafts. Not sure if this is an every day thing, but it was there when we went and we took full advantage. 

The one thing I didn't appreciate quite as much as that delicious mozzarella, was the not-so-friendly guy behind the counter. Seemed annoyed that we were there. Is this a trend in SF?? I'm starting to think so! 

Anywho, food was good enough. I'd go back for another panini, or two!
author: Joana F.

description:
Service wasn't very nice and cash only....being it at bottom of Lombard street you would think they would at least take Visa...but it's local, cute and quaint!  Obviously love the rainbow lights at the counter- prideful ! The open mic night was a blast and an added special touch. 

Located at bottom of Lombard street- plus!
author: Kara K.

description:
YUMMERS!!

Went here on a Saturday afternoon after visiting Lombard Street. 
There was no line when we got there which we lucked out on because as soon as we sat down to order, a crapload of people entered & formed a decent line.

Love the decor, feels so 'lax & chill.
They had the Warriors game playing & a good amount of seating.

You order at the front & pay (CASH ONLY), they hand you a number & you can either sit inside or outside. They bring the food to you.

I ordered the Sinatra Warp (Vegetarian friendly!) OMG sooooooo yummers!!! A wrap with feta, olives, hummus, and avocados. 

FYI, lots of tourist since Lombard street is right there.
author: Camille C.

description: Super cheap draft beers after 5pm. Had the ale and it was light and hoppy. Tiramisu made in house and absolutely delicious. The lady taking our order could smile more, but who could blame her. All these useless tourists pouring in from Lombard being all touristy! Definitely a good place to stop by!
author: Thien-Tam L.

description: In my opinion this is best bar/cafe in North Beach. The location is amazing at Lombard & Columbus
author: Burt L.

description: 901 Columbus Cafe is an awesome spot to enjoy great food and conversation.  My wife and I enjoyed a bite here after checking out Lombard St.  The owner Terik was a great host and offered super suggestions for our trip from San Francisco to San Diego.
author: Cordell R.

description:
Tourist hotspot alert! I walked in on quite a busy day (the St. Patty's Parade), but my order was quickly taken, and I had my meal in no time. If you manage to drop in during a clear sunny day, find a seat right in front of the entry way. There is a beautiful view of Coit Tower, which makes the city feel like home. 

As far as the food goes, I had the "Sinatra" wrap. It's a healthy take with feta, olives, hummus, and avocados. The tortilla it was wrapped in was very soft and fresh. Although, I wish they had whole grain options (I have to admit I didn't ask, so not sure if they do or don't). It also seemed like they had a full dinner menu? and beers on tap.
author: Sarin P.

description: So glad we stopped here. Upbeat, yet relaxing, friendly people, great coffee, great food, fresh pastry. We settled in for the whole morning.
author: Danna S.

description: The perfect place to rest in San Francisco because the restaurant is down from Russian Hill on Lombard, close to Fisherman's Wharf, while in North Beach, drink as the cable cars pass.
author: Thomas Chase Leo S.

description:
I love this place.

Situated in one of the best neighborhoods in the city - 901 Cafe is a nice, comfortable and quaint establishment. 

I enjoy their house coffee here along with their breakfast bagel that includes egg, cheese and bacon. The order of these two things is under $8.  There is outdoor and indoor seating and the servers are completely nice.

If you're ever in SF, I'd stop by 901 Columbus Cafe. It's right by Lambard Street and on the way to Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Trung N.

description:
One of large handful of low key neighborhood places that are pretty low key where you can relax for a beer ($2 drafts 3-6), partake a respectable menu ranging from soup to sandwiches to breakfast. ..or slip into a great coffee and plant your self in a leather chair and chill.

Convenient locale on the way to/from the Wharf and the Financial District.

I always like their cappuccinos.
author: Kevin T.

description:
Some people see this as a great secret gem in the area but each time I have gone to this place I have been highly disappointed. The first time I went I ordered a wrap at the register and when I got the wrap it had the only two items I asked not to be on there. It made it inedible. I am not the type of person to return things so I left unsatisfied. 

The second time was the same deal. The register person couldn't understand what I was ordering and then brought me the wrong item again. I can't get over this happening twice and I will not be returning to this establishment. 

It is incredibly expensive for what they offer including lackluster salads and wraps. It is also cash only which it is not worth doing when you could go to many other better cafes in the area. Do yourself a favor and walk up the street to Cafe Sapore for lunch and Roccos for drinks. There are few places I actually refuse to go to and this is one of them.
author: Nick R.

description:
$2 draught beers from 4 or 5pm I think? Every day. Instant 5 stars. Although they only have 3 different types available on draught, they are still good and you can't complain for $2! I think the beers available were Prohibition Ale, Big Daddy IPA and Baby Daddy IPA. 

The service was good. The food was great with a large selection. 

A relaxed vibe, with chilled out people and some decent tunes makes for a great experience in this cafe. I wish I could have spent more time here!
author: Shane R.

description:
Disappointed  in total experience.  Slow and unresponsive  counter guy taking  orders.  Very unfriendly and impersonal plus missed two items that we ordered.  Very slow in getting  food out.  Though  the prices for a "order at the counter" place were  way to steep.  Would not recommend. 
BTW. Had no restroom.  Was advised to go across  the  street to another place of business.
author: Jim T.

description: I like to come here for lunch when I'm on break from work nearby. It's pretty fast so you can eat there or take it to go if you really need to. The place is usually playing rock or pop on the radio, so the atmosphere is nice and casual. Plus, the area is mostly families so the people coming by are always great for conversation while waiting for your food. There's plenty of seating for a small place but I do wish they had outdoor seating. As far as the food, I can't say much about their pastries but their sandwiches and paninis are a wonderful treat in the middle of the day!  Definitely stop by!
author: Stephanie R.

description:
Belgium waffles- yum. Large menu. Couple of 2 top tables on sidewalk. 
Cash only, ok prices.
author: Tim K.

description: I've been coming here for a long time now, 15 years. Unfortunately nothing has changed. The tables are disgustingly sticky, the chairs have who knows what on them. In addition the floor is decrepit and dirty. At least they have a tv and a decent bookshelf.  On the plus side the coffee and bagels are good and the staff is usually pretty friendly. In any case this cafe could be so much more than it is, It is in need of a major face lift. One more thing. Tourists sit right outside and smoke. The smoke blows right back in. No thanks.
author: david b.

description:
How could I resist a Happy Hour from 5 to 9:45pm everyday!!!  It is more like a Happy Year!!!

There are $2 pints of local SpeakEasy on tap.  Three to choose from.  I got the white ale or that's what I understood from the guy behind the bar.  Also cash only.  That's a great deal.  I totally love the pint glass... it has eyes on there like the angry birds.  (check my picture)  I would love to steal it but that would be wrong!!!

This place also has coffee, cake and free wifi. The happy also includes $3 wines!

This place is everything a coffee shop should be...crammed tables, fake brick paneling, Christmas lights, a window with a note that says, "Do not open Window seriously!"...I am starting to sound like Stefan from SNL!!!  If you've never seen the character then you need to and you will probably be laughing at my last comment.  

They are also rocking U2 in here too.  I love it when a place just puts on a CD and plays the whole thing.  It reminds me of my youth.  You listened to the whole album and you learned to like all 11 songs. Sad part is I have this CD, maybe that's why I'm enjoying it.  Who needs Pandora and Sirrus? 

Okay I kind of like this place and would hang here if I lived here!!!  I think the extra alcohol beer is kicking in!!!
author: Anthony M.

description:
Stopped in here for some caffeine before Lombard. Not good, messed up my Cafe Breve order and ended up throwing most of it away. 

Also how in the world is this place cash only...
author: Jennifer L.

description: Uhm, $2 beers during happy hour, which lasts 5 hours on weekdays? Yes, I will have that, and a little more, please. Decent sandwiches (but lackluster salads) for under $10 (I am partial to the salamocado. I wish it had bacon, but it has salami, fresh basil, lettuce, and cheese. That's already a pretty good combination. There's one couch, and it's perched in front of the small flat screen, so get there and snag a seat early. They show Giants game and other local sports teams, but the majority of people who I see frequent this place are just ordinary folks who want to work or just hang out and enjoy the weather. They even have a printer that prints pages for .75 if you're on a deadline of sorts. Cash only, though, so make sure you hit the ATM, but $2 beers! Come on. That's a win.
author: Danny C.

description:
If I'm in North Beach, this is where I want to be. The beers on tap are only $2 or $3 each. It is a steal!

I have only ever had beer here - big surprise. Haha.
author: Russell Allen E.

description:
I was staying at a nearby hotel on a recent visit to San Francisco.  I saw a sign hanging above this cafe near my hotel proclaiming "HAPPY HOUR 5 PM - CLOSE WEEKDAYS 2 PM - CLOSE WEEKENDS $2 BEERS."  I thought: "Surely it's a very small pour?  Surely it's crappy beer?  Or surely there is some other catch?  This is too good to be true!"

Ladies and gentlemen of Yelp, it's true!  They have three different Speakeasy beers on tap, all for $2 each!  You get full pours of them!  (A pint or a goblet, depending on the beer.)  When I went, they had Big Daddy IPA (very good, super hoppy), Prohibition Ale (less hoppy but still robust amber ale), and a really great Belgian wit beer whose name I can't recall.  The guy in line ahead of me ordered a tea.  And it cost the same as my pint of delicious, local craft beer.  How is this possible?

If I lived in San Francisco I would be here ALL the time.  Camp out with your laptop for the food/coffee/wi-fi during the day, then celebrate your day of hard work--or mourn your day of Facebooking/Yelping/reading the comments on news articles in spite of yourself--with $2 beers at night!
author: Alida R.

description:
We were here when we went to SF last time..walking distance from lombard street...

We rode bikes all morning and didnt eat anything and we had a dinner reservation in about 2hrs..so we stopped by here for a quick bite and some coffee..

i loved the coffee and my wife liked the chai..we got one of the muffins they had and it was tasty..

The place was lively cos they has a 49ers game on that day and people got some beers and we getting pretty exited abt the game..they had a good selection of house beers and it looked like they are famous for their beers too..

Good spot to stop by for some coffee..latte or mocha..or some fresh juice/smoothie with a quick bite during ur tourist trips to lombard streets
author: Sivaram V.

description: Stopped here on our way to Coit Tower for a quick pick me up. was upset to hear that they didn't have any soy milk, what coffee shop in SF doesn't have ample stock of soy milk? definitely won't be going back. didn't even offer to discount the up-charge for almond milk. the latte itself wasn't bad but not coming back.
author: Mario C.

description:
I love this cozy spot.  Sitting on the corner of Columbus and Lombard, with a small patio in front, this place serves coffee, sandwiches, salads, smoothies, and BEER.  And more.  So awesome, a cafe I can take my coffee hating, beer loving BF.  Nice wooden tables, plenty of outlets, and shelves of books you can borrow to read.  Red walls, art on the walls, huge windows, some open air.  Free wifi, twinkly lights, and decent service.  This place is the beatnik living room you want to spend a few hours in, a living room away from your living room.  

Random, they also have a printer, so you can print things.

They just turned the game on and it's loud, and no more cool ambient musica to help me write my heart out, so I'm taking off now.  But I'll be back tomorrow.
author: Super L.

description: Locals and tourists alike are drawn to this corner cafe on the cusp of North Beach and Fisherman's Wharf for the ambiance, good prices ($2 draft beers) and decent food. Characters are abound, so grab a drink, snack and enjoy the scene as it unfolds. Menu is similar to other cafes in the city, sandwiches, soup, crepes, deserts, all for under ten bucks.
author: Brian J.

description: $2 beers during happy hour and a great location with a view of Coit Tower and cable cars rumbling by.  Perfect.
author: Vince F.

description:
Solid 3 stars. 

Cozy little cafe in a great spot, good atmosphere. Unpretentious. The menu looked tasty at first but my iced chai latte was sickly sweet and I'm pretty sure they made a mistake on my Corleone panini (it's supposed to come with pesto, but it had a marinara sauce on it instead?). It was edible but I probably wouldn't come back for it. Altogether a 4 for atmosphere and 2 for food, so a solid 3.
author: Kelli C.

description: 5 stars all the way for this place. It isn't easy to find an affordable dining establishment that hits so many spots. Tasty selection of salads and sandwiches await you along with a large selection of coffee drinks. I recommend getting the chicken Caesar, easily enough for a meal. What is truly awesome about this place is that they have WIFI, a TV with soccer consistently  on, and 2.50 draft Speakeasy Brewery drinks. If I lived here full time,  I would absolutely come here to get some work done or to watch soccer in peace with a quality brew.
author: Eric W.

description:
It says that it's open til 11:00p, but it really only serves food til 9:00p. Then it becomes a glorified bar that only has 3 beers on draft ... albeit at only $3 a pint.

2 workers that only pour beer for the last 2 hours? How can I get a job here? I'll have my iPhone ready and charged for that 2 hour paid candy crush marathon!

But hey, the food is good, if you can get them to serve.
author: Brian L.

description:
The cafe I go to when I'm in North Beach.  They serve Speakeasy beers on tap (which I think are $2 at some times), have pretty decent coffee, and a laid back atmosphere.   They also have a TV for catching the game, if you're so inclined.

For the casual cafe experience minus the faux-Italian glitz of many nearby places.
author: Carlin F.

description: Efficient lunch, drinks counter with good amount of seating. Comfortable couch right in front of TV. Good coffee. Recommended stop in hike up Lombard.
author: J. K.

description: Stopped in to do some work and just kinda hang out for a bit and really enjoyed this place. It's in a great location - not a far walk from fisherman's wharf or chinatown. I had a Chai Tea, which really wasn't all that great. But it looks more like a bar than a coffee/team place so I really wasn't surprised.
author: Ryan P.

description: great spot to have a beer and wait for the cable cars! CASH ONLY!
author: John D.

description:
This place was cool! 

My friends and I walked in craving a warm cup of something to drink (we didn't want to go to Starbucks because we go there all the time and wanted to try a local spot) and were instantly set on ordering the Zebra Mocha because it is their house specialty.  And why not try their best/most popular drink since it was our first time here? 

Let me tell you - the Zebra Mocha was ON POINT. I loved it. I'll be sure to get it again whenever I'm in the area because it was perfect. I ordered it with soy milk and it was amazing. 

The place itself is pretty chill. There are tables all around and outlets so you can charge your phone or laptop. 

This place also has $2 beers! WHAT WHAT?! And I love beer. 

What more can I say? Even their menu looks good. 

Place is simple yet trendy and cool. I suggest everyone should visit this place and give it a shot whenever you're in the area. I love finding these gems in my city.  :)
author: Vanessa M.

description: Really friendly with lots of yummy vegetarian options! Cool atmosphere and somehow we were able to trade some foreign money for 3 cookies haha. Definitely would come back!
author: Laura O.

description: They have a lot of veggie bagels here. I tried the avocado croissant which was delicious! They also have sandwiches, salads, wraps and waffles.
author: Anton P.

description: This place has THE BEST cappuccinos!! Vanilla and hazelnut are the best but seriously best I've ever had. Try one and stroll up Lombard St!
author: Kristina S.

description:
I walked in and looked at the menu for a while - at the salads because I'm gluten free.  Having chosen one, I asked the guy if there were any that were completely gluten free (it's the dressing that's the danger), or should I have my choice of salad without the dressing.  He did not respond - he just stared at me, still with his hands in his pockets.  So, I asked again and his response was that he did not know (and by his look it was clear that he did not know what I was talking about and did not care).  He then asked which one I wanted.  It was clear that he was not going to pay any attention to any ingredients and would be quite happy to serve items which poison me, so I left.

I'm amazed that places like this are allowed to remain open in a place like SF.  Ignorance is one thing, but being quite happy and willing to serve items with allergens in them to people who have allergic reactions is grossly negligent.  I hope the place is closed down.
author: Norman B.

description: Tho I go here most every day. Tip well even. Today I stopped in for a paper cup for water. Even tho I'm pregnant, they refused.
author: Mariana C.

description: Corner cafe. You can take the cable car and hop off right in front of this cafe. Free wifi. Close to a nice neighborhood park. Enjoyed the food - pancakes and a breakfast egg croissant.
author: S Z.

description:
We weary travelers needed a place to rest our feet after walking through the North Beach street fair and decided to duck into this non-descript shop for some refreshers.

My friend and decided to share a soy latte, some homemade tiramisu, and a few bottles of water.  This cafe was relatively expensive but the tiramisu's soaked ladyfingers were exceptional and the latte had a nice subtle sweetness to it.

This cafe was a great place to rest our dogs (feet) but there's also a table outside where your real dog is allowed to hang out.  You can't bring their great happy hour drink deals out there but anything else is fair game.  If I lived in the area, I would definitely drop by for a drink or even just to get some work done.

Food: 7/10

Service: 7/10

Price: $$

Atmosphere: 7/10
author: Joe M.

description: Terrible service and terrible pastries. Went here on a Saturday morning to grab a coffee and croissants. The guy behind the counter was incredibly rude... Seemed like he was spaced out or high or something. Forgot half of our order... Made a soy latte instead of chai. When I asked about the mix up him he just shoved it at me and told me to take it. I've never had such terrible service. And then the croissants we ordered were 3 days stale and clearly from Costco. Would recommend to the owner to better hire his staff... The counter clearly did not belong working in a cafe or in a cafe at all.
author: Simon S.

description:
The strawberry waffle with whip cream was a little taste of HEAVEN.  Thank you for the absolutely wonderful breakfast.

P.S. the caramel Latte and the fresh o.j. was also delicious.
author: Amy V.

description:
I don't like to leave bad reviews, especially if I've only been somewhere once but I haven't had crappy customer service like this in a while - so please excuse the rant. I just stopped by to grab lunch and realized Columbus Cafe only accepts cash. I had some cash on me but not enough for what we ordered + tip, so I asked the cashier if he could just take off one of the items. he said he couldn't b/c he had already rung it in and told us to pull more cash out of the ATM machines instead.

I might have been fine with this if the cashier was at least friendly about it, but he said sarcastically to look at the clearly marked cash only sign scrawled on the cash register. Sorry, I was busy looking at your menu dude, but if service is normally like this I never plan to come back here.
author: Jasper S.

description: Since we are only passing through San Francisco this time around I had to find a good cafe, NOT Starbucks, that was nearby the hotel. This place did not disappoint. Everything is made with care. The espresso was just what I needed and the wraps and granola with yogurt was an added bonus. Get a wrap! They were so good that we ordered more for the road. The employees are super friendly and entertaining. I wish had more time in San Francisco.
author: LeaDan Y.

description:
Amazing place, friendly employees~ Their paninis are dope so as their cappuccino!
If you are in SF, That s the place for a good morning breakfast with nice music on the background ... Cant wait to go back there..
author: Pelin S.

description: Gotta give these guys a good review. Good coffee good food and a small business feel to the place. Feels very San Francisco non tourist. Not to mention if y u want coffee or a microbrew you're set.
author: Luke H.

description:
Ca$h only, lovely little cafe at the corner of Taylor n Lombard where you can conveniently point and laugh at tourists taking pictures with their ipads whilst sipping on some yummy coffee, eat a hearty bagel, drink $2 dollar beers during happy hour, and watch TV.  

homey and quaint ambience, I love the chill vibes.  Come back for open mic night or take your first tinder date here LOL
author: Kimson D.

description: This place has good coffee, cake and a great location. It is really nice to sit outside or work on your laptop inside. Others have mentioned this already, but they have a nice selection of beer with good choices for the $2 happy hour. I make a trip over here every time I am in SF
author: Samuel M.

description:
Stopped by San Francisco for a quick weekend trip and decided to go to a nice coffee shop for breakfast to take a friend over to the touristy Lombard Street.  What do I do?  Yelp it of course! Hahaha..  

I had the zebra mocha and a panini and it ain't bad at all!  Coupled with the free wifi and cool neighborhood coffeeshop feel, it was a great escape from hustle and bustle I'm used to in LA..  Street parking was plenty and, after the breakfast, we were all fueled up to just walk up the hill to our destination... too bad I didn't have a chance to come back later in the day for their cheap beer and wine!
author: Johnson K.

description: It's really hot in here (maybe because it was pretty warm outside), but the smoothie I had was good (strawberry banana). Cheaper version of the Starbucks kind. They also serve beer, which is cool. A huge menu meets your eye on the wall behind the cashier, so it seems there's plenty of dining options to choose from. If I'm ever back in the North Beach area, and needed a beverage, I'd definitely stop by again.
author: Dan M.

description:
Terrible service. 

Ordered the salmon bagel with cream cheese lemon and sprouts, Iced latte with hazelnut syrup and Iced tea.

First of all, no sprouts. They were good enough to sub avocado at no charge.
Iced latte came WITHOUT the hazelnut syrup. Super bland coffee, didn't even taste the espresso.
Iced tea was good but again, very light.

Service was super rude. The bagel comes open faced and we asked them to slice it in half again (for easier eating). The guy gave us a rude look and said, it's open faced. Uhh...that still doesn't do it for me. Can I get a knife? Nope, he just walks away.

NEVER AGAIN!
author: Annie C.

description: Normally I love the coffee here and would give it 5 stars but I had the 'Santa Cruze' (bagel and smoked salmon) but the cheese they used was terrible and bland. I asked the man at the register about the cheese and he just stared back at me. Zero customer service even when I went back to buy a beer. This may have just been the Friday night at 7pm atmosphere but I just wasn't impressed.
author: Martie A.

description:
Sometimes the best place to grab a beer isn't a bar or pub, it's the little coffee shop on the corner. I LOVE San Francisco's independent coffee shops that also happen to serve wine and beer. 

My friend introduced me to this place--they have a great happy hour that runs until 9 PM where they serve $2 pints of 3 different Speakeasy beers on tap. My friend pointed out that this is even a better deal than the Speakeasy Brewery itself! 

Other great things about Columbus:

- free wi-fi
- a bookshelf library with communal books
- yummy looking treats
- generous seating area
- a comfortable environment
author: Lisa N.

description:
Most of the cafes in north beach are over-priced and super touristy. 901 is pretty much the exception to this. I think it really helps that it's about halfway between north beach and fisherman's wharf, kind of a tourist no-man's land.

I usually drink tea or beer when I'm here, but I've heard the coffee is pretty good. The vibe's super calm and you can just chill here for hours. Free wifi and you can print too (not sure how much that costs)

Next time I go, I really want to check out some of the food. Last time I was there, I noticed a few vegan/vegetarian options that seemed appetizing.

Only downside is that it is indeed in North Beach, which means you kind of have to go out of your way to get here. But hey, if you're going to see a show at Bimbos, why not stop here beforehand?
author: Jon T.

description:
The cashier guy who works here is R-U-D-E! 

I haven't received crappy customer service like this in a while. I stopped by here with a few of my friends for lunch. Columbus Cafe only accepts cash. As we were reading the menu, thinking about the prices, because once again, It is JUST CASH, the guy is staring at us like we need to hurry up. Me and my friends frantically ordered some salads. 

We were in a rush to get back to our classes, and we kindly asked the cashier if he could be a little fast with our food because of this. He was rude and did not seem like he cared. Our food finally came. The salads were large in size, and nothing special. The Iced Chai is delicious, I have to give them that. 

Overpriced, and touristy. Probably won't come here again.
author: Emmanuella Z.

description: Good coffee, great paninis and above all  - a cozy, comfortable cafe to sit, read, or work on the computer - something you can't take for granted these days when such places disappear one after the other.
author: Arkady I.

description: Dropped by for coffee this AM en route to work, lots of options in NBeach I come maybe once a month.  GREAT HOT BLACK COFFEE it was so good I drank it black, very tasty.  Maybe just a good day all around but I didn't remember the coffee being as good usually.  Then I went back for lunch to check on Champions League futbol and again (coincidental) had the smoked salmon, on ciabatta, FANTASTIC.  I don't write many reviews but do love the quality non-chain, non-yuppie local businesses and this cafe is one of 'em.  Amy Adams also bought me a bagel here once : ) : ) : )
author: Michael G.

description: Lovely spot for a beer and a bite. Their wraps are quite tasty and filling. I chose the veggie Sinatra and ended up splitting it with my honey. The peanut butter cookie topped off a great relaxing meal. Take the time to sit and watch the people strolling by.
author: Cynthia G.

description:
LITTLE COFFEE SHOP NEAR THE CROOKED-EST STREET IN SF
(4 stars) 

How do you enjoy a baybreezed yet humid evening in the city when trying to kill some time before heading to a place you dearly dread?  Felt sorry for myself that I'm the selected "lucky" one to work overnight at the office. Thought I'd treat myself to something yummy. Sit at a little cafe and post up listening to itunes over a hot beverage and dessert and people watch. 

- taste, beverage and desert - great. they have a full menu from beer, espresso, breakfast & lunch items, pastries, etc.
- price, i could get better for cheaper but i'm willing to pay
- service, great!
- ambiance, little cafe with a bunch of random house plants for decoration
- atmosphere, very chill. everyones in their own business mostly on laptops. F/M ration, 1:12 (including staff 1:14). I being the one -- ackward. HAHA jk but i thought it was funny

HEFFER-STATUS:

HOT COCOA ($3) - the barista put it in a clear glass mug and topped it with whipcream. the hot cocoa wasn't chalky and rich like those nestly quick mixes, it was perfect. i'm not suppose to take in caffine while i'm currently on my "treatment" for my illness, so i went with Hot Coco instead of my usual.

TIRAMISU ($5) - i love me some desert. There wasn't much pastries behind the glass case at this late in the hour. I chose the Tiramisu and hope to godness it is good. I know i'm not suppose to have caffeine on my "treatment" but it wouldn't hurt if i'm not drinking it *winks*. I need something to keep me awake if i'm slaving myself overnight. Good stuff, pretty decent. The bottom was a bit liquidy but edible. 

Will I be back? Maybe.

Until the next review...
author: Jane A.

description:
Damn, I should have come here for my 901st review!...

Well, I'm glad the owner didn't come up with some misconceived name like the Coffee Hut or Caffeine Express or Jolting Java for this super-casual place. Keeping the address in the name makes me remember it all the more since I don't live in North Beach. Jamie W. and I were strolling feeling a bit peckish after our paninis at Mario's Bohemian Cigar Store Cafe.

We saw a group huddled around the sofa watching the Democratic Convention on a flatscreen, while others were focused solely on their laptops. They appear to serve the typical sandwiches and salads, but we went for the last piece of tiramisu in the glass case. It was really light and tasty, and I have no idea where they get it. But I'd come back for that in an Italian minute.

Not much else to say except they serve a good cup of joe, too. If I lived around there, I'd be spending some serious slouching time there. The vibe is so laid back here that it feels like one big Valium in a martini. That's a compliment actually.

COFFEE/DESSERT - 4 stars...that tiramisu was definitely homemade but whose home?
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...casual to the extreme
SERVICE - 3 stars...chill, dude
TOTAL - 4 stars...for a coffee place, sure, I'll give it four stars
author: Ed U.

description:
Love the zebra coffee drink- both hot and iced.  It's very laid back here, and you're guaranteed relaxation with conversation, a game on the flat screen, or even a board game or two (ie. Cranium) that are on the bookshelves. 

Service is OK, not effusive. I see some regulars here from time to time wih their laptops.  Note that waffles are not served all day but you can get sandwiches with Italian gangster references, ie. Corleone, Gambino, etc. Very cheeky.
author: Miran C.

description: I really love the atmosphere in this place. It's comforting, warm, and quaint but still has the hip vibe of a typical coffee shop in the city. I'm also a huge fan of the free wifi and $2 drafts! Didn't have any food, but the nice young man next to me commented that his sandwich was excellent!
author: Jennifer R.

description:
I went to a comedy show at Cobb's (next door) and waited for my friend at this cafe. It's a charming place- small, but they have everything you could want. Beers on tap and a looong happy hour, sandwiches, salads, pastries and a variety of coffee and tea drinks. They also have a large TV for catching the Giants' games and board games to play during football season. There are comfy couches and also some tables and chairs and WIFI and even a couple computers in case you forgot yours. I try to stop here whenever I'm walking through North Beach. If I lived in the city I would have to live in North Beach so I could make this my neighborhood hangout. Anyone in the area looking for roommates? 

;)
author: Daisy S.

description: This place has gone down the hill much. I live 2 blocks from here and used to come here for coffee and sometimes bagel. Went there today to get coffee and a lox bagel. The bagel came out missing half of the ingredients on the menu and I got charged $1.00 extra for a splash of soy milk.... Plus the guy works at the counter is pretty rude.
author: Ladywolf M.

description:
-Cash only always is a downer.
-The food is pretty good, a little over priced, but I continue to go back.
-CHEAP drinks (beer & wine) during happy hour, which is like all day everyday. Really good prices there, but not much of a selection.
-It would be a good place to go and get some work done that doesn't require much focus (searching for apartments, jobs online, etc.), not a good place to study for tests or really do serious work though because the music is really loud and it gets pretty crowded.
author: Megan F.

description: Lots of healthy options. Cash only. They do have an ATM inside though. Our family of four had a Strawberry Banana smoothie, Sinatra wraps, Turkey sandwich, and the salads that come as sides are delish. All food was fresh.
author: Andy P.

description: Great spot with great specials. We were traveling to the area and needed wifi but didn't want to give in to the great commercial god of coffee. Thankfully this corner shop came to our rescue. Check it out!
author: Justin B.

description:
Bestest, most coffiest deliciousness.

Nothing beats this place! Absolute awesome and friendly service, amazing coffee with a great selection, good waffles free wi-fi, soothing atmosphere, I honestly could go on forever (and ever).

This is a place to come to when you just wanna hang out, write, read, and drink coffee. 

And they play The Smiths here quite a bit too! Which makes your coffee shop way less cool, bra.
author: Lee L.

description:
Only knocking off a star because of the TERRIBLE SERVICE.

Food  & Service: 
We ordered a few bagels and an egg sandwich and they were pretty tasty but it took 45 minutes to get our food; meanwhile patrons who came in after us were walking in and out with their orders. Ridiculous.

Hoping it was a fluke bc I'd like to come back!

Ambience:
Nice and peaceful vibe to come in and do some work or web browsing.
author: Sangita A.

description:
I couldn't get enough of this cafe when I was staying down the street in North Beach last weekend in San Francisco.

They have great breakfast sandwiches that range from $4-$6, which was my go-to every morning. I recommend getting it on a bagel (they have croissants too... tough choice)! Grab a cup a coffee with your breakfast too because it's delicious.

I went three times over the course of 4 days. Enough said.

Don't forget that it is CASH ONLY. They do have an ATM, but I recommend getting money from you home bank before to avoid the charge.

Now I want a breakfast sandwich...
author: Kathleen A.

description: Good sandwiches, chill atmosphere. Great happy hour beer specials. No cell phones at the counter sign!
author: Patrick S.

description: Lovely local cafe conveniently located between Columbus Ave and Lombard St ! Free WiFi, ample outlets, a variety of inexpensive food options, $2 draft beers and $3 wines from 5pm. Local cafe with chilled out tunes. The staff are smiley, nice and helpful. Diverse crowd.
author: Lianne M.

description:
3.5 stars - a gorgeous day in SF so we were out looking for a place with outdoor seating.  After missing the boat at a couples places closer to home, we walked toward fisherman's wharf and stopped here.  

Always wanted to try this spot because of their HH special but the place feels a bit blah.  While we were checking out the menu and scoping out outdoor seatings - some folks were kind enough to let us know they were leaving.  Hubby sat outside while I went in to order.  It's not a big menu but it took me a while - the various salads, bagel, panini, regular sandwiches all look pretty good.  But I focused on choosing something that went well w/ a cold beer and not too heavy.  

Got the gambino panini (mozzarella, tomato, basil, pastrami and purple onion - $8.50 and two pints (DBA? and a pale ale) at $4.50 each.  Grabbed the beer and our number outside.  It took quite a while for the sandwich but we were enjoying the sun and not in a hurry.  

Sandwich was good but the bread was too toasty - just a bit too much crunch, at least for us.  It came w/ two pickled jalapeno peppers.

It's a great location to people watch and close to Cobb's.
author: Gloria H.

description:
Thinking back is dangerous business. Reminiscing is often a sure-fire way to the bottom of a bottle, what with those warm days long lost, and all that Jewel and Duncan Sheik playing for some reason... and why is it always raining outside? 

When I think back to the coziest days in San Francisco cafes, nothing tops memories of 901 Columbus Caffè. It's my go-to place for work. Why? I'll head here around 2 or 3 in the afternoon, grab some coffee and maybe a delicious bagel sandwich, and start tapping away on my MacBook until 5. By then, I'm about as drained as Ron Jeremy. Luckily, it's happy hour: $2 Speakeasy pints and $3 house wines from 5-10pm every day. It's spinach and I'm Popeye. Yabba dabba doo, I'm back in form, mixing up my cartoon references.

It's a day well spent, rain or Jewel, and I'm always sure to bring a few friends with me.
author: Keane L.

description: Crowded and noise everywhere , if you want to read a book and some coffee and want to have a wonderful afternoon , don't come here.
author: Xu J.

description:
Typing as I'm sitting here. Famous for its speakeasy beer, its a small gem good for studying, reading a book or playing a few rounds of chess.

There's always popular music playing in the background and the coffee's not bad either.
author: Minks M.

description: Initially the counter server didn't seem to want to look up and notice me, but then was friendly.  But this is god coffee and amazing boscotti.   Sweet, crunchy, larger than normal boscotti perfect for dunking in a tall glass of Italian roast coffee.  Very cool old coffee house vibe.  Cash only.  Good for breakfast.
author: Mike M.

description:
A coffee shop that serves beer.  What's not to like?

I also saw my husband's doppelganger here.  It was a little creepy.  But he wasn't a gay version, or a spanish wrestler version, or cab driver version.  He was just a normal laptop using doppelganger.  I'd like to think he was some secret warlord plotting to take over the world.  What?  It's possible...
author: Angeline K.

description:
What cool little pace to drink coffee, enjoy some food, cozy up with a good book in the rain, imbibe in some adult libations, or do whatever other leisurely activities that might tickle your fancy when you've got some time to kill.

Over Thanksgiving weekend, the lady and I decided it'd be a fun idea to get saucy in Sausilito, via cycling across the Golden Gate Bridge. The only problem... was that she didn't have a bike, so we rented one next door at some touristy spot that typically slings two-wheelers to boners from Nebraska or Ohio. 

The weather had been rather ominous all day, but it remained clear for the better part of the morning/afternoon... right until she'd signed on the dotted line and we were about to peddle off into Marin County. It started pouring right outside the bike shop, so we decided we'd wait out the storm with a tall cup of coffee across the street at 901.

The interior is very warm and inviting. From the street, you'd have no idea it was such a welcoming place to kick your feet up for a while. They had TVs streaming a college football game, a stocked bookshelf with literature to borrow for the day, couches, tables, armchairs and more. Of course, they had a nice selection of coffee drinks, teas, sandwiches, pastries, and all of the other goodies you'd come to expect from a neighborhood coffee joint like this one. Maybe it was just the spirit of our visit (lazy day off, just enjoying the slow-moving afternoon), but there was just the most amazing vibe reverberating throughout the space, and I almost wished the rain would have never stopped.

That being said, the storm passed in about 15 minutes, and we were back on the road... but not until I made a serious mental note to come back for a return visit, with at least a good 3-4 hours to spend doing nothing at all.
author: Ruggy J.

description: Funky, eclectic place. Friendly service. My wife had the Marlon Brando, it was so GOOD, we can't remember what I had. My sandwich was good also, but the Marlon Brando was just FANTASTIC!! Oh yeah, $2 drafts, in SF, seriously!
author: Barry B.

description:
I hung out for a few hours at 901 to do some work before heading over to see a Sketchfest show next door. I had never been here before so I wasn't really expecting much. I ordered a vanilla latte and was surprised at not only how flavorful, foamy and delicious it was - but how pretty it was as well!

They have a lot of seating and tables, and their music selection was really great. It ranged from 80's funk to jazz standards. I believe Borat would say that it was "Very Niiiice."

The Godfather was playing on the flat screen, muted with subtitles so those who wanted to pay attention could. Very cool. I'll be back soon!
author: Tatiana J.

description:
My go to cafe to work out of in the city. They make a good latte as well. The homemade cookies are soft and tasty. 

More awesome is when there is a basketball game going on they put it on.
author: Vinay A.

description: $2 Speakeasy craft beer pints, 3 different choices on tap, from dinner until close during the week and from noon to close on the weekend??? Seriously, how do they stay open? I went here every night I was in SF. Simply the best beer deal in the Bay Area, hands down. I wish I lived next door.
author: David C.

description:
how to I explain this place?  Well, we were told by a pretty drunk guy to go here because "that's where Jesus is" so we figured, why the hells not?

Turns out, we just missed Jesus...his shift was over...ZING!  But really, just a nice little cafe in the middle of a very fun neighborhood in San Fran.  If you're looking for some coffee that's not Starbucks, head here.  Didn't get a chance to eat anything, but ya know...tasty drinks.
author: Glen S.

description:
I always go here while waiting for a show at Cobbs around the corner, when the line reaches my table outside I get up and take my place with the herd.

They can be slow here and good luck finding a table but it's a cool spot with drinks (coffee, booze, etc) and light snacks too.
author: Christopher Steven O.

description:
I'm reviewing this place based upon their awesome happy hour specials only!

I've visited the 901 twice now, and what brought me back was their cheap $2 draft beer happy hour!  Seriously...where can you get that awesome deal?  And we're not talking Bud or Coors...they have $2 hefeweizen!

Looking to get away from the hustle and bustle of North Beach, head here.  It's got the chill atmosphere of a coffee shop, but they serve cheap beer!  Their food looks and smells great too, but so far I haven't tried it.

If I'm ever in North Beach and in need of some libations, I'll head here for sure.  What a great deal!
author: Greg S.

description: **BASED ON ATMOSPHERE** I walked in and then walked out. Dislike the atmosphere. So dark and gloomy. Went to the neighboring Cafe Sappore instead
author: Letiza M.

description:
It's a great place to grab a sammy or a salad and do some work since they have free wifi. However, the day I went it was about 100 degrees inside, not sure why since it wasn't a really hot day in SF, so I sat at a table outside. I had the Fillmore Blues salad- mixed greens, crumbled feta cheese, roasted pecans & dried cranberry with raspberry vinaigrette. It was good and would have been even better had it not been drenched in dressing. When will I learn to ask for dressing on the side? I would eat here again or at the very least have a cup of tea while doing some work.

For the full review please visit:
http://consumingcolumbus.blogspot.com/2013/05/901-columbus-cafe.html
author: Elizabeth C.

description:
"No phones at the counter, baristas are people too" - At the register

How can you refuse a study bar open late, close to opening time at Cobb's next door.
901CC is the perfect little place for activities and festivities.

-$2.00 Speakeasy draft pints
-$3.00 wine 
-Board games  
-Free Wi-Fi 

If your headed into Cobb's like I was or on a bar hopping adventure in North Beach you can't go wrong with 901CC.  With all the other pricey places around the area its nice to see such a simple place have some success.
author: Dennis S.

description: Nasty nasty customer service. Went to order at the counter and found out its CASH ONLY. Tiny sign on their cash register. We didn't have any cash on us, only credit card. We apologized and asked to cancel the order (by the way order wasn't entered yet and no food made). He wouldn't cancel it and called it unfair. He insisted we pay??? What??? The order wasn't entered and we didn't eat or take anything??? I wasn't sure what's so unfair but ignored and went to another store. Places like this that demands cash only should be on the watch list for government tax authorities, let alone on the avoid-at-all-cost for most restaurant goers.
author: Ah M.

description:
So, I stopped in here the other day to enjoy a couple of their $2 happy hour pints.  I realized late that night that my wallet must've fallen out of my pocket and i retraced my steps back to the Columbus Caffe.  

You can imagine a sleepless night knowing that $200 in cash, my diver license and credit cards may be long gone.  I rushed to the Caffe early the next mornign at 7am and they had it waiting there for me!  

It's good to know there are decent people at the Columbus Caffe! Thank you to the #1 place in the city!
author: Charlie B.

description:
Ooh, I have a new favorite cafe!

Pluses:
1.  Super friendly staff
2.  Cozy
3.  Free WiFi
4.  $2 Draft Beer/$3 Wine from 5pm on
5.  Delicious Cafe au Lait
6.  Seats outside for people-watching
7.  Sinatra Wrap is deeeelicious and healthy (cucumber, spinach, tomato, hummus, feta, and olives in a wrap and heated)
8.  Bookshelf with a mini library of books
9.  Great music.  (Today I stopped in during a torrential downpour on my way home from the gym.  I heard old Cure, Echo & the Bunnymen, and even A Flock of Seagulls.  Heaven.)

Minuses
1.  It's not closer to where I live (the walk is about 15 minutes)

OK, scratch the Minus.  That should actually be in the Plus category.  If this place was located any closer to my apartment, I'd be there for breakfast, lunch, and dinner every day and would never eat at home.

I think I'll go tomorrow and try something from their breakfast menu...
author: Kimberly B.

description:
I think a lot of times, I stumble into random cafes just to use their lavatory. But someone told me last night that theres no such thing as "random" even when you put your ipod on shuffle. 

This place seemed nice, I like cafes that sell beer and coffee its always nice to have that option.
author: kim w.

description:
Extremely disappointing pastrami sandwich! One piece of pastrami 
 and no cheese on what was supposed to be a 'melt'. We will not return.
author: Matt T.

description:
Oooh Monterrey Bagel  where have you been all my life!!!!
I get an everything bagel with cream cheese topped with a huge amount of lox (salmon) and red  onions.

It doesn't came with tomatoes but I always ask them to add it. 

They are some tiny improvements that could be made such as slice your red onions paper thing and soak them in vinegar and I thin tomatoes should be part of the sandwich.

I got brewed coffee on the other hand is no good and NON-dairy creamer they have on the table is  terrible and should give you the option for some half and half.   On the other hand they seem to make some excellent Espresso machine coffees so I would stick with that.
author: Manny R.

description: Although I didnt eat here this place has $2 draft beer all day! And it isnt bud light, actually good craft beer.  I will be back for sure!
author: Sarah E.

description:
It's blissfully quiet here on a sunny Saturday afternoon. Spirited red and blue walls, worn by an undulating tide of cafe goers, stand in salute to football (as defined by the rest of the world) playing on the flat screen tv in front of a small leather couch that has seen more than its share of ebullient children and spilt beer. There are no more than a small handful of customers huddled over laptops, ambient instrumentals drifting over their heads.

901 is another 1-stop shop cafe offering coffee, breakfast, lunch, beer, and homemade tiramisu. Given the breadth of offerings, you'll sacrifice nuances like yogurt & granola interpreted as strawberry Yoplait yogurt layered on conventional store-bought granola (in a tiered parfait, no less), but it's acceptable if you're simply looking for a quick bite to eat and a place to rest your legs.
author: Christina J.

description: My husband and I recently spent a few days in San Francisco. We were on the way back to our hotel after walking around chinatown and needed a caffeine fix. That's when we stumbled upon 901 Columbus Cafe. The cafe latte was good and looked beautiful. The chocolate chip cookie was also very good, soft in the center. :)
author: Jessica M.

description: $3 house wine? Ok by me.  Went here for a glass of wine and to wait a bit before seeing a show at Cobb's.  It has a very nice, friendly, cozy atmosphere.  There were a couple of people working on their laptops, but it still felt pretty chill and laid back.
author: Chloe M.

description: Delicious homemade tiramisu to be found here!! It's baked in a glass pan and is a tad pricey for $5 a slice, but the fluffiness of the whipped cream and the generous espresso flavor makes it a delight worth sharing. We came in late at night, bought the last piece left, and it was still delicious! Even though the place says it closes at 10:00pm, we stayed a few minutes after and no one was rushing to kick us out.
author: Evonne L.

description:
Hooray for cheap draught beer! Hooray for a flat screen TV that will showcase Giants games whilst you enjoy cheap draught beer! Hooray for a place that serves cafe food and drinks in case you want to watch the Giants game, but are not in the mood to enjoy cheap draught beer!

The staff is nice, too.
author: M M.

description:
I GUESS 901 Columbus Caffe was not too crowded and had available seating.  I GUESS the internet was not too slow, since it was not bombarded like a busy Starbucks router would be.  I GUESS the music was a good mix of 80s and 90s hits.

No matter how hard I'm trying, I can't rationalize a can of diet Coke costing $1.75.
author: Andrew M.

description:
I think I've been spoiled by all the fantabulous coffee shops in the east bay...Perhaps my expectations were set too high by yelp, but maybe this kinda vibe is just not my cup of joe :P. (Pun intended).

Anywho, had 2 hours to kill before work and after reading about this place on  yelp a few weeks ago I was excited to try it out! (I love my coffeeshops!).

Despite the large # of outlets and free-wifi (which if a coffeeshop doesn't have now a days it's just behind in the stone age), the vibe isn't as welcoming as I had hoped: feels like a bar, the cushioned seating is torn, the tables are a bit grunge, and the service priorities are a bit skewed.

When I went to order a sandwich, the guy said "It will take about 20 minutes to make though because we just had a large order over the phone"... Is it just me or would you not try to make a sandwich for the 1 person waiting for food in your restaurant rather than an order for 100 other folks NOT present?

All in all, the food IS good for the price and there is a huge assortment to choose from which all piqued my interest, but I shall venture else where otherwise to unwind.
author: Gail N.

description:
Fine comfy place to enjoy lunch.  I also really liked the mural on the side of the building-  although noone inside seemed to know the artist.
Here's a photo of one of the murals
http://www.flickr.com/photos/scotthessphoto/4972011229/
author: Scott H.

description: A simple deli, but with truly delicious food. Warm wrap sandwich (chicken, cheese, greens) with an excellent green salad. Fresh fruit cup, even the cantaloupe was tasty. And we all know how rare that is! Flavorful and chewy oatmeal cookie. My favorite part? The homemade iced tea. Black tea, unsweetened. Superb flavor. Savor it, because refills are not free (evidently thanks to surrounding businesses who abused the privilege).
author: Jeannie S.

description:
Stopped in for a quick lunch while walking from chinatown to fisherman's wharf. As a fan of bacon, I had to keep it simple and go with the BLTM. Delicious. Crunchy, but still meaty, salty...it really is like meat candy. I'll have to go back again one day and try some more things on their menu. 

Yes, their bacon earned them 5 stars.
author: Mike S.

description: Good little coffee joint.  We ordered a soy mocha and an americano.  Both were very good.  It has a nice vibe but I would make one suggestion.  Clean the tables because they are sticky.  Windex and a towel and then this place is even better.
author: Joe D.

description:
Chill little cafe - think Central Perk from Friends. This place isn't just coffee, cake and a paper. Whether you're looking to browse the web/kick your boyfriend's butt at checkers and sip a cup of coffee....OR have lunch and a beer or few (at $2 a pint during happy hour, you can't beat it!), I think this is a cool spot for anyone. Not too loud, either, and I like the music they usually have playing. They also have a couple seating areas outside, which is awesome for people watching whilst sipping your $2 beer, haha. One of those places that I would frequent if I lived in the area. Minus 1 star for the smelly, although interestingly decorated, bathroom.

**White Lightning beer was good, tiramisu was eh....the lemon bar was delicious!!!
author: A. A.

description:
I have been looking for a truly great coffee shop in the Bay Area (not San Francisco in general, but the BAY AREA) for years.  YEARS.  That's a friggin long time.  And I think I've finally found one.

It's everything I've been looking for in a coffee shop.  It has great drinks (including an excellent white hot chocolate).  It has a happy hour, during which beer (GOOD beer) is $2 and wine is $3.  It has great food, including options beyond the usual sugary pastries (I got the broccoli-cheddar soup, it was delicious).  It has a COUCH and a big comfy chair (why is this such a big deal in coffeehouses in the Bay?  Does everyone here just like to sit on hard-ass chairs in general?), as well as a lot of seating for big groups and general socializing with people who aren't hiding behind their laptops like I was.  It has outdoor seating. It's open relatively late. Did I forget anything?  Oh yeah, it's CUTE too.  I sat and wrote for hours.

I'm really excited for our second date.  I think this one's a keeper.  It might be the one.
author: Sydney H.

description: April 2012.  Walked by this place, plates on tables were cleaned so assume the food would be great. Waited in line where you order, then they bring your food.  More dirty plates at counter.  Service terrible.  Clearly staff was missing.  The guy who finally started to take our order became distracted with another patron.  There is a big breakfast bagel selection but upon ordering the Belvedere (egg cheese bacon), we learned they were out of croissant and bagels.  Decided to leave.  Wouldn't recommend for anyone walking around the neighborhood looking for a quick bite.
author: Jen L.

description:
This place is so awesome I don't know where to start.

I lived right next door, this place boasts the cheapest happy hour within a 3 block radius, and has the most amazing staff.

Free WiFi, comfortable environment, good beer, and movies...

Besides not having capers for my bagel with lox this place is FLAWLESS!!!!!!
author: MJ D.

description: Great service! The ice moka is delicious! A bit overpriced...but like everywhere in SF!
author: Stéphanie C.

description: Oh my god the coffee; not only can they make a killer cup o' joe, they even do latte art, something I haven't seen since I lived in Melbourne. The ambience is awesome, chilled music, friendly staff and a homey feel to the place. Cookies are homemade and sublime and the menu looks awesome.
author: Alice R.

description: Two people working the whole counter. Service was decent but slow. I ordered the "house special" the Zebra Mocha. It was the worst coffee I've ever had. The Monterrey bagel was horrible, the salmon wasn't fresh. I would not return or recommend.
author: rena s.

description:
It's apparent in other reviews why this cafe is so great.

I'll just say this: If you don't totally love this place, and especially if you don't like it for whatever reason, you need to seriously reevaluate your standards as a human being. What more could you want from a cafe? Really?

The only way it could possibly be better is if, instead of the 80s music, they played what would normally play on your Pandora (without the random commercials trying to get you to buy diamonds or Sketchers). But you know what? It isn't physically possible for the cafe to play everyone's Pandora at the same time-- so shut up, eat your yummy food, drink your $2 speakeasy, and smile.
author: Jen N.

description:
North Beach is an awesome place for awesome food. You can pretty much go anywhere and the food is good there. The one thing I did notice though is that there was no AC, so on warm days, it's not very refreshing. 

The food was really good though, I will say. The bread was nice and toasted and fresh, and the stuff inside the sandwiches were really good too. There was just something about this place that seemed very.. fresh and healthy. Clientele looked like they were frequent visitors to the place and were very relaxed, sitting and reading, enjoying the warm day. 

Food was good, and North Beach is always awesome for food. I'll probably be back to this place for another good sandwich. Maybe on a cooler day though.
author: Jenna L.

description:
Very chill music and atmosphere in the evening with very comfortable seating. $2 drafts of Big Daddy. Free Wi-Fi.

As a local I love meandering the city and finding cool new places. I immediately fell in love with this place and little did I know this comfortable Friends-ish style cafe was also right next to the comedy clubs and the park on Columbus Ave as well.

My only complaint is it gets a little busy and is hard to find a seat sometimes, but everyone seems to keep to themselves and not get too loud conservatively.

I definitely need to come by here again more often.
author: Terry C.

description:
On a lovely Monday morning off work, I decided to revisit my old stomping grounds in Northbeach. After a long walk up Columbus, I ended up at 901 for a cup of coffee, a good book and some free wi-fi.

Listening to Johnny Cash on their sound system, watching the cars drive down Lombard street and watching CNN on closed captioning was one of the best ways to start the morning. I only intended to go in for a cup of coffee, but when I saw banana pecan belgian waffles on their menu, I knew I had to have it.

The cappuccino was delicious and rich but didn't have the same beautiful artwork like the pictures. The waffle was the perfect texture--crisp on the outside and soft on the inside topped with banana slices and whipped cream. It was delicious and I was all too happy to spend a fantastic afternoon in a shop with reliable wi-fi and a great cup of coffee. I will be back.
author: Stephanie H.

description: We came to visit on July 20th between 11 am and 1145 am. My brother wanted coffee so we walked there after visiting Lombard Street. My dad (who is a diabetic and in need of a restroom) walked in with my brother and proceeded to walk towards the restroom. A bodyguard (seriously) blocked my dad from using the restroom until my brother paid for the coffee. He made us watch the whole transaction go down before letting my dad in. Is that really necessary? The bottom line is that we were paying customers. And it's just a restroom for goodness' sake! What did he expect my dad to do? Pee in the street? Give himself his insulin shot in the middle of the restaurant? BTW, the other stores said that we could use the restroom inside 901 Columbus Café. They are right but they don't make it easy. As far as coffee goes, it was mediocre. I was going to buy a mocha but didn't because I was pissed. My kids got chocolate chip cookies and they were decent. They would have been better if they were warmed up, which they didn't.
author: Karine W.

description:
I work here and I love it. Obviously, I'm a little tired of the menu, since I've been eating lunch every day for the last couple years, but everything is very fresh, and we won an award for cleanliness from the health inspector. Lots of stuff made in house including the hummus and salad dressings.
This is a place I would hang out even if they didn't pay me. Couch, high definition tv (we'll let you change the channel), friendly regulars. Of course, much busier on weekends, especially holidays. Wide menu available all the time (including coffee drinks, tea, beer, wine, waffles, granola, bagels, sandwiches, panini, wraps, salads). Open 7-7 daily, including most holidays. Free wifi for your laptop, also desktop computer access for a nominal fee. 

Stop by and say hi to me, I'll make you a pretty latte. 

Edit: Now open until 10 pm every day.
author: Meredith K.

description:
It's hard to describe how delicious my Babylonia Sandwich and Strawberry Banana Smoothie were at 901 Columbus. I'll try, though. (I'm plucky like that.) They were SO delicious, I was humming to myself as I ate, and that's something I used to do as a kid, but only when I was really happy. The Babylonia is avocado, cucumber, red onion, sprouts, hummus, lettuce, tomato, pickles and cheese, and I had mine on toasted wheat bread. (Check out the photo, which makes me weep with nostalgia.) The smoothie rocked 'til the break-a dawn.
 
Maybe I loved it so much because I'd just arrived in San Francisco, and was starving, and probably would've been ecstatic to munch on some Wheat Thins. Still, I'd rate the meal highly under any circumstances. Additional temptations on the menu included the Grilled Foccacia "Wise Guy" Sandwich (pesto, chicken, mozzarella, tomato and onion) and the Pastrami Melt.
 
Other plusses: friendly service, cozy seating, free WiFi, cute location (with an outdoor view of Lombard 's "crookedest street" in the distance), and what appeared to be a tiny lending library.
author: Robert M.

description:
NORTH BEACH LOCALS BEST KEPT SECRET !!
    This place is everything that Starbucks wants to be. A true neighborhood cafe. 
     If you are looking for a good place to hang out,use your computer or just have a few drinks with friends while in North beach Columbus Caffe is a great choice.
     Not only is there FREE INTERNET -you will be happy to find outlets strategically placed so that no matter were you are sitting you can plug in.
      SPEAKEASY is on tap (3 choices) for only $2 everyday after 5pm
For $10 I had 2 beers a huge bowl of Corn Chowder and bread.While I downloaded a movie on net flicks and still had enough to tip the friendly professional staff.
author: mike r.

description: I ordered a Maui smoothie and it was delicious! Also had an onion bagel, very burnt but still good! I will definitely be back to try some thing else! Awesome vibe & good customer service!
author: Bailey C.

description:
I'm shocked at all the wonderful reviews, because my experience was terrible. I got a take out of the chicken wrap. It was the blandest thing I've eaten in quite awhile. Not only that, but there was something wrong with it as it tasted off. I think it was the hummus, as it had a slightly chemical taste to it.
I ended up getting food poisoning, as I had some nausea, upset stomach and mild light headedness after eating it. I felt like I wanted to vomit. I know someone else who got take out with me who got sick as well. 
Definitely not coming here again.
author: Kel B.

description: Favorite coffee shop in SF! Great prices! Cafe Ole is amazing!!! Heaven in a tall cup!
author: Eve V.

description:
Living in North Beach, this is the perfect place to bring visitors from out of town for a very casual breakfast.  It's convenient, inexpensive and has a very "San Francisco" vibe based on its random interior decorations and the fact that it's located right on the cable car line.

Their espresso drinks are fab, as are all the bagels I've tried so far.  I haven't had the breakfast burrito, but friends have said its quite good.

I also like grabbing an evening coffee or beer here with friends.
author: Kelley W.

description:
Cool little cafe. Our barista was nice and funny, not snobby or elitist like some people fear when they walk into a place like this.

My zebra espresso was pretty delish and the boyfriend enjoyed his ice coffee.
