OH I ALMOST FORGOT -- the chocolate chip cookies were amazing. They looked hard and burned in the case, but they were soft and squishy and almost melty when we got them. Awesome.
author: Amuse B.

description: They didn't make my coffee drink correctly (ordered an iced drink but they made it hot). I couldn't believe they wouldn't make it again and instead tried to argue with me! Poor business sense.
author: B W.

description: Great place to relax after traveling all day! Great atmosphere and friendly service . I recommend
author: Assaf L.

description:
I've been here once - it was a few weeks ago as I waited for our show at Cobb's (they're very close in proximity - the line for Cobb's actually wraps to the front of the cafe).  

The place wasn't super busy on a Friday night - I recall that about 3 tables were occupied.  There was a happy hour special going on - I think it was for $2 beers and $3 wine.  I ordered the wine - I felt a little weird about it as the guy poured it from a bottle sitting next to the register and the bottle didn't look "fresh".  The bottle looked a bit sad as if it had been sitting on a store shelf for a year with no one wanting to buy it.  The wine was also served in a lowball styled glass which was fine by me - a bit ghetto, but A-OK.  

Between our party, we ordered wine, beer, soup, a panini and possibly a sandwich (sorry, memory is hazy).  Overall the food was OK - nothing really special to write home about.  

This place is good if you want to grab a cheap beer before your show at Cobb's (assuming it's happy hour).  Aside from that, it's alright.
author: Laura C.

description:
I live and work a couple blocks away and decided to try 901 out with a couple colleagues for lunch. It was an utter disappointment. 

Our group of three ordered two salads and a sandwich wrap. We were one of only three tables that were occupied. It took about twenty minutes to get our food. I'm willing to accept a lengthy wait if the food is stellar, but this wasn't the case.

The food was incredibly mediocre. A $10 sandwich should taste like a $10 sandwich, not a public school lunch. The lettuce was brown on the edges, the flour tortilla on my wrap was gummy. Perhaps the worst offense was the "chicken". Remember the grilled chicken-like product you were served in school? Basically the white-meat version of particle-board? I'm pretty sure this was the same product. It's got a spongy, tofu consistency, with a bad aftertaste.

My colleagues were equally dissatisfied with their salads and soup.

I will probably not be eating here again, which is disappointing because I try to support as many local businesses around here as I can.

If you're thinking of trying 901 out, I'd highly recommend instead going to the other end of the block down Lombard to Caffe Sapore. I've eaten there numerous times and have never been disappointed.
author: Brian G.

description: Decent food, not too cheap. They have a hodge-podge of events on some nights. No frills and great for a quick sandwich.
author: Amber M.

description: The barista is RUDE! I asked for a spiced chai tea and the barista gave me a chai latte with whole milk. When I told him I ordered the plain chai tea, he argued with me. He wouldn't give me my money back or provide me a different type of tea to replace the terrible latte. He also refused to give me a side of eggs, which admittedly wasn't on the menu but many dishes have eggs. The employees offered service grudgingly and refused to answer questions about the menu.
author: Rachel B.

description:
This place is my new favorite spot for nom noms!

I had been in before for dessert and coffee, but today I got to watch PeeWees Playhouse (woo) and hung out for a good couple of hours while the boyfriend did work stuff. 

We had 2 delicious sammies, the BLT and the Corleone panini. The BLT was one of the best ive had, the tomato was delicious (which im a nazi about!), it was full of bacon and on delicious sourdough bread! The panini was yummy as well, stuffed full of salami and cheese. Mm!
author: Britney K.

description: A little coffee shop at the bottom of the hill of Lombard street.  I had the chai latte and a bagel sandwich with egg, turkey and cheese.  Really light and simple.
author: Johnny W.

description:
I'm generally a big fan of cafes and chugging coffee like there's no tomorrow. However, when I stopped in 901 Columbus, I took full advantage of their awesome happy hour ($2 drafts FTW!). Sorry, coffee mug, you'll have to take a backseat this time!

I paid 901 a visit with my boo after he and I biked across the Golden Gate Bridge to Sausalito. It was prime time for happy hour so we grabbed a few $2 pints. The place is quaint, staff is friendly and they had foreign films playing on the TV. The cafe is located on a semi- busy corner, which makes for a fun time aka people watching! My bf and I took noticed their fleet of board games and played a round of intense Scrabble. Note: there must be 2 bags of tiles mixed in with one Scrabble board because our Scrabble game lasted foreverrrr and we had a bazillion tiles left over!
author: Laura L.

description:
Happened to walk by here on the way to Lombard Street with a friend while acting like tourists. was drawn in by the big happy hour sign which made us sit for a few beers before hiking up the crookedest street in the world (sounded like a good idea at the time).

Bartender was extremely nice and the seating arrangement was great. We sat outside (a little chilly) but was able to quickly warm up after a few drinks.

Stop on by! Would give 4 stars but definitely trust a local's review.
author: Andy N.

description:
I stopped by this place on the morning of my wedding for a quick coffee. I dug the music; the scenery; the young lady behind the counter was very sweet for 9:00 a.m.; and my best friend said her zebra mocha was out of this world tasty. My coffee wasn't too shabby, either!

The Verdict: Had it been any other day, I totally would have hung out there. I would love to go back.
author: Cara S.

description: This was our rest stop before we walked up the steep hills of SF on Lombard to see the Crooked Streets and Coit Tower nearby.  Nice service and cute ambiance.  Coffee is cheap, so it beats the tourist rip-off places.
author: Geraldine K.

description: Worst breakfast burrito ever, but I do like the $2 Speakeasy drafts!
author: Brian L.

description:
EDIT: I posted this review earlier under Columbus Cafe, but it should have been posted under 901 Columbus Caffe! I certainly got confused...oops! My mistake, and a big thank you to Karlee D. for the heads up!! 

********

After about 20 minutes in this cafe/bar, I was pretty impressed.

The draught beer choice was good, the service was friendly, the location was great and the ambiance is entertaining. 

901 Columbus Caffe (CC) has a lot to offer, whether you're looking for a snack, happy hour special or just a place to surf the internet on their computers. 

Another cool aspect: the ceilings in this place are HIGH, which allowed the decorators to get creative and give CC an even more amazing feel. 

Go there immediately and be merry!
author: Tom A.

description: I love this place.  The 2-for-1 beers are as good as it gets.  It's always a fun time when hitting this spot up in the city.  Good people, good vibe, good service.
author: Chad N.

description: Great coffee... if you are coffee lover and love to chill in a nice place with a cup of coffee and some snacks, this is the place to go to. They have free wifi.  The most important thing is they have good lattes...
author: Judy J.

description: You can't beat a neighborhood cafe that offers $2 beer, service by friendly familiar faces, and a low-key chillax atmosphere. This is why 901 is a winner. Jason, Rachel, et al are awesome and deserve some love. Oh and the smoked salmon bagel is delish.
author: Jon L.

description: $two draft beer after five pm all night....sandwich and panini too...wooden large cafe and plenty large table seating..in and out...
author: Hen A.

description:
I spent a lot of time here. I can guarantee you that the staff thinks I died or was kidnapped by the creep who jacked Elizabeth Smart. I'd job hunt here all day online- sometimes clocking 10 hours-- so I'd say I'm a slight authority on 901. Free wifi. Great space. It's one of the few coffee shops in SF where you don't feel cramped. You can work, eat or sit on the sofa and watch the Giants game. 5 PM is quitin' time! $2 brews. Get the 'Big Daddy IPA.' It's super strong. I'm a lush and two would do me in. Nothing like a $4 high. All of the staff (The owner, T, the barista, Alex and other staff are really chill and great.) However, there is one barista (short/angry/always there during the day) who is the biggest prick. He never smiles. He's rude and 9 times out of 10 he gets your order wrong and acts like it's your fault. I actually saw him tell a customer he needed to change the keg for the beer he wanted then when the guy went to his table he poured him a beer he didn't order! This place gets a lot of gullible tourists- so he gets away with it. 

Don't let one douche spoil what is otherwise a great spot to grab pints and have a laugh with friends. And, if you see that rude worker- tell him Lianne from New York says to fluck off.
author: Lianne S.

description:
I was VERY displeased with the service I received here. I ordered the turkey club, DRY, no mayo,and it was served to me with mustard, which I am allergic to. When I alerted the man behind the counter,and asked politely to have the sandwich re-made, he pointed to the menu with a "can't you READ IDIOT!?" look on his face, claiming the menu said mustard and I'd only specified no mayo, so it was my my mistake, not his and he wouldn't re-make it unless I paid for a second one.  Perhaps it was my fault for not reading the menu carefully enough (in what world is mustard put on a standard turkey club?), but this man's shitty, condescending attitude was unnecessary, and at $9 a sandwich, I decided not to pay for a second one, and left the place hungry, irritated and having wasted my money on nothing.

Whether my fault or his, clearly I was unable to eat the sandwich and any other cafe would remake something for someone with a food allergy. 
Needless to say I won't be going here again.
author: Jenna S.

description: The server is very rude since the minute he saw us. He made us wait next to the other Custer coz he think we're too slow.  He always says "what do you want next". Apparently his English is very limited but he has a big attitude. I asked for a hot milk, but he have me cold milk. I came at the counter and I asked him politely if he can warm my milk. He didn't answer for a few seconds and just smirking.  A couple seconds later, he took my milk and didn't say anything.  After a couple of minutes, he just left my milk on his counter.  I took my milk and it was only a little bit warm. I was looking for a manager but there is none. We were waiting for our meal for 30 minutes and is still not ready. Eventually  spoke to the elderly manager (that appears to be his mom )that her server was rude. Before I even explain the detail, she already said: "no he's not.  We have to be that way. " she eventually let me finish my story and later apologize, but I don't think she did anything else. I think this place has changed ownership and the new owner apparently ha no sense of customer service. Don't go to this place of you don't want them ruin your vacation mood.
author: Thomas E.

description: This is a good choice for a neighborhood cafe in North Beach. Free wifi, lots of seating, and the lattes are pretty good. The food is fine, nothing spectacular, but it is much better (and friendlier) than Sapore at the other end of the block. Some outdoor seating for when the sun is out. Cash only, so don't forget to hit up the ATM first!
author: Katie R.

description:
Their coffee (and beer) is good and cheap. I'm no coffee connoisseur, but the price ($2 for a pint glass) is worth it! The staff is friendly and helpful, and the ambience is great.

It's always busy but not packed, right up until closing. I'm usually there for the wireless internet from 6-10, so I don't know what it's like earlier in the day. Everyone is super friendly, there's always games being played on the screen, and it's generally a cozy atmosphere. I'm a fan of their music choices too--I often find myself foot-tapping to the beat.
author: Tracey Z.

description:
This place has a distinctively sitcom-y vibe to it. I mean literally. 

My mum and I went here for the $2 beer and a $3 glass of wine happy hour after moving me into my new flat in north beach. We both kept commenting on how we expected Ross, Rachel, Chandler, Joey, monica, and Phoebe to show up. you can almost hear "smelly cat" playing in the background.

Hahah, but this place is truly neat. Very San Franciscan in that business people come here after work for wifi and a beer and students do the same. A good place to wind down after a long day of working at that internet start-up your so proud of working at, or trying to finish those art school projects. 

Oh and the food is tasty too. Cheers, sf!
author: Lynn C.

description: Not a bad spot, but nothing blew me away. The decor, the quality of the food and the prices all seem pretty average considering the amount of similar establishments I've been to in the city. The menu is fairly large and there is plenty of seating, but i wouldn't go out of my way to stop by. That being said, if you are in the neighborhood and happen to be close, it's not a bad place to try out
author: Taylor C.

description: We've been here a couple of times for breakfast and I think it's OK.  The location is great!  Nice place to walk to if you're in the neighborhood.  Good for kids.  Good cup of coffee.
author: t d.

description: LOVE this place for breakfast and caps... Just hate how slow the service is!
author: Lacey L.

description:
Been coming here a couple times a week for years, and will continue to go, since it's my neighborhood coffee shop. I guess I'm a creature of habit, and I do like the food and the staff. However...

Coffee drinks: No good since Jason left.  I keep ordering them, but they're laughable now. The barristas just sort of slop it out there as quick as they can. Are the barristass untrained, or just don't care? Hard to know.

Sound system: awful!!!!!! It often has this weird high-pitch whine to it. Maybe their ears aren't so good and they don't hear that high of a pitch, but it actually hurts my ears. Also, they keep it up way too loud, so I'm guessing their ears aren't so good or they're inurred to it.

Bathroom. Where do I start? Never, ever, enter their bathroom. It's dirty, will go months without soap, and has one of those paultry hand dryers that everyone knows doesn't work. 

But more than anything, for years and years it's smelled like raw sewage. Ugh! I guess they're used to it and don't smell it anymore. People, you cannot have a public bathroom and have a non-working fan. The fan...  which barely worked to begin with... broke down completely about 4 years ago. The room has not had a breath of fresh air for years. The stench will turn your stomach. Honestly, how much can it cost for a new, powerful fan and an electrician? Soap and paper towels? Honestly, do they care that little?

Also, recently, their "art" is crap. They used to have interesting stuff, but now it looks exactly like that stuff you buy for a few bucks on Chinatown sidewalk, bad still-life on cardboard with some varnish thrown on top so it looks like the real stuff. 

Still, I love you guys. Funny how much we'll put up with once we've become comfortable with a routine. Aren't people funny?
author: Sharon B.

description:
What's not to like?  $2 pints for happy hour that goes to 10, free wi-fi, great coffee, comfy/homey environment, and friendly staff.  I'm a north beach local and this is a regular hangout
they also have computers to use if you are traveling!
author: Sameer D.

description:
$2 draft beers for happy hour? ...SOLD!

Oh yeah, and they have friendly baristas that crank out cutsie latte art, yummy snacks, and a big selection of veggie-friendly foods. Top it all off with free internet and a few outside tables in prime location for people watching and you've got yourself one fine cafe.
author: Sarah S.

description: Good coffee and great Carmel frappe!  The bagel breakfast are good also. Great place, highly recommend. The one thing to note is they are cash only.
author: Rick B.

description: Craft Beer on Tap!  Tables outside!  Ahhhhh
author: Jenn B.

description: Great little cafe. Didn't have the coffee, but the food is good and the $2 craft beer for happy hour every day is great. I like the atmosphere, too...couches, a bookshelf, and the game is usually on their one big screen tv for whatever "the" game happens to be.
author: Kevin H.

description: The hubby and I stopped in here after a long day of moving and apartment hunting. We were tired, hungry and in need of coffee. 901 Columbus Cafe was convenient and highly rated. The smiling guy at the counter was eager to take our order so we hastily made our selection, a panini and an iced mocha and chose a table outside as it was way too hot and stuffy to sit inside. The sandwich and coffee came quickly and were good, a nice addition to our afternoon. Although there are so many other shops in the area, this one was reasonably priced, didn't require a long wait at the hostess table, and was quick. I won't say it was the best sandwich I've ever had in SF, but it wasn't bad for the money. Another time I'll have to try out their beer selection and maybe another panini. Overall, nice place, nice people, fast service. That's good in my book!
author: Emily S.

description:
If I lived here in San Francisco, I'd live in North Beach.  And if I lived in North Beach, I'd be HERE at 901 everyday.  

Yes, it is cash only.  I have no problem with that.  They offer free wi-fi, newspapers, games, books, and a really good menu of sandwiches and salads.  Apparently, they make good breakfast and coffee drinks... but I wouldn't know about that because:

After 5pm, this is the best place to read a book, the papers, or take advantage of the free wi-fi---the wine and beer go super cheap!

The guy with the pony tail is always nice.  The seating options are good for a place like this (the wall/window-bars, the two-seaters, the limited four-tops, outside), though it can get a bit crowded at times.  

Like I said, it's cash-only.  Fine by me, but because of the variety of foods and drinks, I do suggest they adopt a credit/debit card system.  I think the increase in sales would make up for the processing fees.  My largest bill there was about $20-some bucks for two... this could easily have tripled if they took cards.  We could have added deserts and more drinks.

Overall, very much recommended.  If you go here just once, you will probably become a regular.
author: J C.

description: Tasty muffin, tasty coffee.  Little pricey, but the location's good, and the hours they're open make it really accessible.
author: Tim W.

description: So my husband loves stand up comedy. I really could take it or leave it. So, we agreed to meet up after the show at Cobb's. I got there early and  was looking for a spot to hang out. 901 Columbus Caffe was the perfect spot. Free wifi, pleasant atmosphere, and a great cappuccino.
author: Bernadette W.

description: Great local cafe right across from the North Beach Library and where Lombard Street meets Columbus Avenue. The coffee's are always smooth, never burned. Wi-Fi works well and couches and seating is comfortable for a place that just feels "chill."  Good crowd, not too hipster or yuppie; just regular folks. :)
author: Omar M.

description:
I lived up the street from this place and it's definitely better than Caffe Sapore around the corner. Comfy and relaxed atmosphere, decent chai tea lattes and a couple of toasty sandwiches that are 99% satisfying. A good place to stop in for a coffee or a snack.

The only issue is that it's in the middle of tourist central--but, well, so are you.
author: Ashley M.

description: 901 is far and away my favorite coffee shop in North Beach, and I've pretty much been to them all: Roma, Greco, Capriccio, Sapore, Trieste, etc. What I like about 901 is the super laid-back vibe - though things do heat up a bit at night during happy hour. The food and coffee are great, but what really makes 901 stand out is the ambiance (great music, nice layout, comfort) and super friendly staff. I've also found it's a great place to read, study, and be productive if you like to work in coffee shops. Reliable Wifi is a big plus. I'll give you a heads up that the service can be a bit slow, so if you're in a hurry maybe 901 isn't your best bet. Aside from that, this place unequivocally rocks.
author: Ben D.

description: Bustling cafe that attracts an even amount of tourists and regulars. The high energy atmosphere that I experienced (heightened by the showing of Terminator 2 on one of the TVs) might not be for everyone. Nevertheless, I enjoyed my afternoon working on my laptop here, enjoying the free WiFi and ample outlets. The coffee was good and served with great care by a friendly barista. In short, I'll be back.
author: Daniel Levis K.

description:
Busy little neighborhood coffee place filled with people staring into their laptops.  (At least when I go there for a coffee...) 
I'm all for a little web surfing, but crowding up places to just sit lonely clicking away seems like a sad way to spend a weekend afternoon.
Decent cafe sandwiches and coffee and beer selection with a Happy Hour.
Cool.
author: Kev M.

description: I bet that most people have no idea that this place used to be the location of a club called "Wolfgangs" that was owned by Bill Graham, and that Jerry Garcia, Randy Newman, The Grateful Dead, and U2 (one of their early US appearances), and many other famous acts played here.  Take a look around...when you are in here, you are in a place of rock and roll history.
author: David S.

description:
This cafe is everything a great cafe should be

- Nice, friendly staff
- Comfortable environment
- Completely free, unrestricted Wifi
- Good music that isn't too loud
- Really good food

I love coming here to study. The employees never care that I take up a table and their wifi for hours at a time while getting coffee refills or drinking free water. I almost always get one of their smoothies when I come here, they're delicious! The food variety is impressive- wraps, salads, paninis, breakfast bagel sandwiches- and everything I've gotten so far has been quite tasty. The vibe here is so chill, they have outdoor seating for when it's sunny, and their happy hour can't be beat. I wish every cafe were this great. Only bummer is cash only, but that's half the places in San Francisco anyway.
author: Michelle B.

description: Surprisingly good. I wanted to go to a coffee shop and get some work done before heading to Trader Joe's, and this was nearby. Good atmosphere, reliable wifi, and an iced chai tea latte that tastes like apple butter (which I'm told is an Amish -- not California -- thing).
author: Adam D.

description:
This place is my local favorite for relaxing with friends. It serves perfectly either as a casual place to relax on a warm Saturday afternoon with beers, or as a great cheap place to meet up with friends before heading out to dinner/bars.

The panini sandwiches and salads are very tasty if you want to stay here and eat.

$2 draft beers! And we're talking GOOD beer - Firestone Double Barrel Ale is my favorite currently on tap. You just can't beat that in this city.
author: Kevin M.

description: Coffee is alright, atmosphere is awesome. Great place to work and hang out... plus it's open late!
author: Ben D.

description: I ordered a cesar salad and was very disappointed. It took forever for them to make it and there wasn't anyone ahead of me. The salad came on a big plate, but was a very small portion and the romaine lettuce was so soggy that I couldn't even finish half of it.
author: Gina M.

description:
Good place to stop in for a coffee or a beer. Bring your tourist friends and they will be impressed. 

Ambiance is very cool, bartenders are quick and attentive. Happy hour is a touch cheaper. Good place to kick back with your lap top and watch the world go by.
author: Yoen K.

description: Nice atmosphere fair prices. Had the bagel with cream cheese and lox, which was really good. Had a latte which also was really good. Would go here again.
author: Westwood D.

description:
Needed to get something to eat before going to Cobb's which is almost next door (you have to pass the entrance to a "weekly" hotel first).

I read the "YELPS" before heading out to Cobbs, but didn't realize that this place was located right next door.  Anyway, the billboard proudly stated that they serve draft beer for $1.50 each until 10pm (duh, they close at 10pm).

OK, I ordered a veggie sandwich with hummas, sprouts, tomato, onion and avacado on wheat toast.  It was $8, but really yummy.  And I'm a meat-a-sauras too!  So that is quite the compliment.

Mr. meat-a-sauras - won't touch anything healthy unless it's iceburg sweetie pie of mine ordered the BLT Club thingie on the Ciabatta, and he thought it was awesome!

There were little bistro'esque tables outside and some tables inside, along with couches and oversize lounge chairs facing a big screen TV.  There is a bar along the outside wall, books to borrow and enjoy and a seating area with Wi-Fi.

This place was awesome, the staff was super cool and friendly.  When we stood in line, we told other people about the great price of beer and then held their spot in line while they ran and had a drink.

This is a great spot and deserves your business....if you're cool enough to stand it!
author: Bee D.

description: Awesome local coffee shop, I recommend the turkey sandwich
author: Guy J.

description: The Zebra Mocha is heaven.  Love this place!
author: Kim S.

description:
Great location, good menu and reliable internet have kept me as a customer for years. I've even had work meetings here, as it's usually quiet.  For someone who lives across the street and works from home... I couldn't be a more reliable customer (for years as I mentioned)

However the customer service, which has always been painfully slow and lacking in personality, finally reached the point of losing me as a customer. 

-By slow, I mean 10 minutes for a bagel with cream cheese. If you plan on staying for hours, this is no problem, just don't expect your food to come quickly. 

-As for customer service, if you want a refill of a cup of coffee, you get it for half price. If you want a refill of an iced coffee, you pay full price. Even if you just spent $14 on lunch.  If you want to dispute this logic with the workers, you get snide comments about coming back later to talk to the owner. 

-If you need to print a page out, you can also do this here. But you'll end up paying several dollars for just one page. Far more than other coffee shops. 

-If you want a $9 sandwich, and aren't in a hurry, this is your place. 

-Usually not too crowded. Chairs are whatever, nothing fancy, no different than most other places. 

-Lots of tourists stop in and out given proximity to lombard street


As for me, there are just too many great options in the area to deal with an annoying workforce and expensive coffee. 

Cafe Sappore, on the other side of the block.... HERE I COME!
author: Ryan T.

description:
Recession, re-shmession, that's what I say. 

From 4-7 pm here, good draft beer is cheaper than a grande starbucks coffee. Cheaper even than bottled water. 

From 4-7 pm here, all is just as it should be in the world.  So come mourn the loss of your purchasing power with a frosty brewski and watch as other patrons stuff themselves full of sinful splurges like waffles and homemade cookies.  

Minus one star for the early closing time.  I rarely get off work before 7 pm, and the bosses frown upon returning to the office after a mid-afternoon beer break, even when I explain that financially (we're talking calories per dollar here) it makes more sense than a trip to the  vending machine . . .

******UPDATE . . . . they are now open till 10 PM, with happy hour till 9. Damn, I am powerful
author: Chelsea R.

description:
This is my favorite place to drink Firestone Walker's DBA. 

and not just because all beers are $2 a pint!

The folks at the cafe are all super-friendly and it's a great place to people-watch. Plus there's (free) wi-fi, and it's walkable from downtown. 

Plus, Firestone Walker on tap!
author: alejandro p.

description:
I came here with my friend for TIRAMISU after walking her dog around the pier.  We were on the way back to her parent's house, and stopped by here, because it turns out that of the many years that she has lived in North Beach, she has NEVER had a tiramisu.  CAN YOU BELIEVE THAT?!  

I love that they have outdoor seatings, because it's often troublesome to find a place to eat whenever we have a dog tagging along.  +1 star just for that!  

Based purely on the tiramisu that we ordered here, I'd give it 3/3.5 stars.  It was alright, but having tiramisu as one of my favorite desserts of all times, I have high expectations for them.  I have still not yet found anywhere that can top the tiramisu from Whole Foods in Washington DC's Dupont Circle.  The ratio of sweetness and slight bitterness from was just PERFECT.

Cafe Greco would be runner up to Whole Foods in DC, meaning it's the best place SO FAR in SF.  I am still on a mission to find that PERFECT tiramisu in SF!  =D  

Sidenote: Not all Whole Foods are created equal!  I've been to the one in downtown SF and one in Colorado for their tiramisu, and was left deeply disappointed. =(

Based on the other yelpers' reviews, I will definitely come back to try the paninis and other yummies! =D  Stay tuned for my updated reviews on this place!
author: Lisa Z.

description: One of the best cafes in the area! Great prices, food, ambiance (whether to study, people watch or catch up with an old friend)! Only drawback at times - cash only.
author: Elle V.

description:
I'm happy to have this spot as my local cafe.  Coffee is always strong and tasty.  In the mornings, I'm partial to the Tiburon bagel (fresh basil, tomato, bacon, and cream cheese on a whole wheat bagel)  or one of their great waffles.  I like the one w/ fresh strawberries and chocolate chips.  My boyfriend enjoys the banana and pecan(?) one.

Lunch I love their BLT.  I know. . .I know.  A BLT is a BLT.  Not hard to make it tasty but for some reason they are especially good here.  Also they have great Ice Tea.

Service is always very friendly.  Free Internet access for those days you want to hang in a cafe and read up on the latest news/gossip/etc.  And I believe they just put in a jukebox-type thing for those who enjoy playing dj.

Only negative, like the other review said, is that it can get packed with tourists on weekends.  For some reason, big tour buses love to stop right in front of the cafe.  So that can make for a long and noisy wait.

Overall, it's a great neighborhood spot.
author: Amanda U.

description:
Great place to grab a bagel and sit outside to people watch. 
Not necessarily the BEST bagel I've ever had but the ambiance and service made it well worth the trip. I recommend.
author: Brooke L.

description:
The drafts are now $2, but whatever, I'm older, uglier and more expensive these days, too. They're still $2 from 5 pm to 10 pm.

Bagel with hummus and coffee is $4. You can watch European football -- that's "soccer" to you, meathead -- on the plasma TV, sit on the couch or give tourists bad directions from the tables outside.

In sum: all you could want in a neighborhood coffee shop. Bravo 901.
author: Chris R.

description: Wife and I came in for some breakfast had a breakfast bagel sandwich called Bellvedere wife had a Waffle, both ordered Americanos coffee was good breakfast was delicious and hot freshly made, nice ambiance friendly staff. Read sign that advertised Speakeasy for $2 a pint from 5-7 will be back for that.
author: Rafael R.

description:
Friendly staff. Great coffee.. GREAT waffles.

They put on Football whenever its on. I watch English Premier League games from here (and these days Euro)

I spent a lot of Saturday and Sunday mornings here (And Cafe Sapore). I spent a lot of working days (Fridays) over here too. Its generally peaceful and you can do your own thing. No one bothers you
author: Brijesh K.

description: Good wifi, good coffee and food, and $2 beers at happy hour. Booyah.
author: Tommy G.

description:
Conveniently a minute's walk away from Tattoo City, I walked in here for some food before my tattoo appointment. 

The small cafe with free wi-fi boasts affordable breakfast items (nothing over $10) and a lot of sandwiches to choose from. 

I ended up selecting the Crunchy Tuna sandwich on ciabatta (you have your choice of bread) because it had avocado in it and a Pellegrino Limonata to wash it down with. 

The sandwich was one of the best tuna sandwiches I'd ever eaten. It had toasty ciabatta, cheese, tomato, pickles, lettuce, sprouts and celery. The tuna mixture wasn't too creamy nor dry and the avocado was a nice touch. At $8 for the sandwich, it's a little pricy but I loved every bite of it, before and after my tattoo. Love to go back again!
author: kristin e.

description: Stopped by for lunch after a walk back from Fisherman's Wharf.  Was hoping to have a Turkey Club on a Croissant, but they were all out of Croissants, so I had it on a baguette instead.  They failed to list the club had mustard on it, so I didn't realize until a couple bites in.  I'm not big on mustard, so I ate the meat and toppings but skipped the bread.  Also had a strawberry smoothie, again not bad, but not great.  Most of my downrank of this review is that the place is CASH only, and I preferred to use my corporate credit card to make it easier to expense later.  Really laid back place, and was otherwise fine, but who takes cash only these days?
author: Nick F.

description: Watch Peru - mex soccer game a couple of weeks ago, it was great!! Great happy hour, friendly bartender, very helpful and fun !
author: Karen P.

description: Great selection of vegetarian entrees and tasty looking smoothies and desserts. We didn't get to try any of it because the service was SO slow. I was the 4th person in line and 20 minute went by before I was the 2nd person in line. As I was leaving I noticed a small sign on the cash register that said CASH ONLY. good to know before you come here :)
author: Denise L.

description:
Got nothin' but love for 901 Columbus!  I've been a lunchtime devotee since April, and it's by far my favorite cafe.  While it gets its fair share of tourists, no one can deny its close-knit neighborhood feel.  A real breath of fresh air from those tourist traps down the street!

My ideal solo lunch break includes a good book, a seat at the high counter along the far wall, and one of 901's incredible sandwiches or salads (or maybe some waffles one of these days).  The dining area is so cozy, and the music is great too.

Their salads and sandwiches are really, REALLY good.  Some personal faves that you need to try: 1) SUNSET BOULEVARD SALAD: baby spinach, cucumber, watermelon, feta cheese w/ raspberry vinaigrette...they used to have mint leaves & pine nuts but took them out!  If at all possible, please please please bring 'em back. 2) ANGEL ISLAND SALAD: baby spinach, pineapple, feta cheese, w/ dijon dressing...again, took out the pine nuts but still a good bet. 3) SEACLIFF SALAD: romaine, red onion, toasted pecans, sprouts, tuna salad, parmesan, w/ olive oil, balsamic vinegar & lemon...was a staple for me while on the South Beach diet. 4) DIMAGGIO WRAP: hummus, lettuce, tomato, red onion, pickle, falafel, yogurt dressing, and hot sauce...in a panini-pressed wrap.  I love this thing, it's incredible.

The only thing that occasionally irks me is the service: it's soo o o o SLO OOO O W.  I've watched potential customers walk out because no one's at the counter to take their orders, and a couple of times the staff straight up forgot to place orders.  I try not to let it get to me and I wouldn't have a problem with it, but my lunch break is only an hour long.  I still recommend this place to co-workers and friends, and I still support this cafe because it's simply a great place with a cool vibe.  If you've got a little patience, it's totally worth it.
author: Andrea U.

description:
One of the best coffee shops in the neighborhood. A variety of great breakfast and lunch items and good coffee drinks.

After 5pm, they have $2 beers. Sit outside, play a boardgame, drink cheap beers, and people watch. Sounds like a great afternoon to me.
They also have a great assortment of boardgames, and two computers to use for a cheap rate if you need to hop on the internet.

Two negatives- cash only. And because this place is so popular, sometimes service is slow. But if you don't have any place to go, this is a great place to sit and hang out.

It's a coffee shop you def. want to spend time in...not just hop in and hop out.
author: Holly O.

description:
J'adore 901 ! I'm a local in North Beach and this is my fave coffee spot.  All of the staff and the owner are super friendly. Their WiFi is great and you can study there for a while without getting the boot.

Their espresso is great, and their cookies are THE BEST in SF. Get the chocolate chip cookie right after they come out of the oven and you'll never be the same again! 

Special props to $1 Draught Beer EVERY M-F from 5-10 pm... I guarantee you NO other place in SF has that kind of deal!
author: Mai A.

description:
Any place that makes me feel like I'm in my Italian family's living room at Christmas is AOK with me. What is WRONG with me?!!? How could I never have been here?! 

I was waiting to meet a bunch of friends here for breakfast and the best song came on "Eh Cumpari" - Julius Larosa - please download it and sing and laugh along if you are Italian! OMG- I called my dad immediately and said, Dad- what's that song you used to sing at Aunt Marty's?! Doot doot doot doot- ooh sah-o-phone...

Too funny.

I only had a fruit salad here, which was yummy...but the bagels looked good and I'm definitely going back and going to see about parking my butt down with some wifi and Italian classic tracks in the background :o)
author: Diane S.

description: Great food especially the tuna club and waffles. Comfy environment and free wifi. My favorite place to go and work.  Good coffee.  They are also into soccer so they show a lot of matches which is great.  they also show all other sports.
author: Kevin M.

description:
To the owner of this establishment,  I think you've accomplished cafe perfection! To start, everything one can consume here is perfect! I've tried just about everything. Let's see...there's the excellent espresso to compliment a delectable cookie or homemade tiramisu. There's the deliciously healthy wraps and sandwiches (Sinatra for veggie-lovers, or the WiseGuy for the carnivores). The salads are just as scrumptious, the soups are delicious. The waffles are heavenly (with bananas and pecans...or OR strawberries and nutella...oh dear).  

Then there are the beverage offerings! A perfect cafe must have excellent coffee and espresso which is exactly what you will find here. My first drink here was a zebra mocha which is a cafe favorite but lately, just having the solo espresso is satisfying as it is wonderfully rich and aromatic. Oh, and then, here's the best part...ahem... $2 drafts/$3 wines from 5pm?!? Seriously, you can't find a deal like that in any kind of cool neighborhood. Not only that, but the draft pale ale and house red wine is really really nice. 

The perfect cafe must also have the perfect ambience. This spot is cozy, comfortable, and unpretentious with nice music and lighting and even outdoor seating if that's your thing.  To complete the package, there's free wifi, computers and a printer if you don't have your own, an array of books and board games, and ultra-friendly staff to serve you. You can even zone out and watch the tube. And if you don't want to do any of that, the location is great for people-watching. Grab a seat outside and watch tourists, locals, and cable cars pass you by.
I've been to plenty of cafes in my time and this has remained my favorite the last couple years. In fact, I think I will head there now...all this time reviewing has got me craving an espresso. 

Here's to 5-star cafe perfection! Cheers!
author: turtle power e.

description:
Um, let's see. $2 beers. Free wifi. Yummy salads (which I do admit have a bit too much cranberry dressing). Nice staff. Warm and pleasant environment.

Isn't that enough to warrant a 4-star rating? Well just in case it isn't, this is THE spot to go to if you're waiting for a show at Cobb's next store too. Just come try it out.
author: Aaron F.

description: I think because they bank off of tourist going up Lombard they don't care to create a pleasant experience. I live right next door and would consider myself a "regular" there, not a bad spot- comfortable, clean and usually a nice crowd of peeps.  The coffee was decent, the bagels were tasty, and they have a really good happy hour ($2 beers). After my experience this morning I'll take my business elsewhere. My boyfriend and I sat at a table, opened our computers and not even 10 mins went by when the barista came by and rudely asked if we were going to buy anything. I hadn't even had a chance to contemplate what I wanted to eat but I was so turned off by how he approached us that I decided to leave.  He could have approach the situation differently, instead of asking us if we were going to buy anything maybe he should have asked what we wanted to eat- it's all about how you word things, in my opinion. I'm sure me not going there anymore will affect their business but I was just astounded by their ill-mannered staff.
author: Dani A.

description: Damn good coffee and goods prices to match
author: James G.

description:
Food and drinks is yummy and not too pricey.

I had the male employee and he was sorta nice but not really.....if that makes any sense.

Would eat here again if I'm in the neighborhood which is rare.

The husband and I have our best Sunday morning warm fuzzy memories here... sitting at "our" table outside in the sun with our "regulars."  Me and my Bodega bagel with avocado, tomato and sprouts and he with his strawberry/chocolate chip waffle.  It evokes my appreciation every time for being a local and just walking down the street to enjoy a casual breakfast reading the paper.

If I could change two things it would be: 
a)  Their coffee is incredibly bitter (and I typically drink it black)
b)  I eat here at least two weekends a month and I still don't feel like anyone there recognizes me.  Someone play me the Cheers song people!  :)

I'll keep coming.  For some reason I do like it better than it's next door neighbor Cafe Sapore.
author: Shasta N.

description:
Any respectable review of this place must begin with a mention of the $1.50 drafts.  From 5-10pm... like every day.  Awesome. The setting is super cozy with couches, dark wood floors and a real neighborhood feel.  Even tourists stopping by on the way to the Wharf seem to blend in with the locals, as people sip, surf, read, and write.  

The sandwiches are solid and the juice selection is ample, but let's get back to the draft beer.  On a clear evening I can sit outside with my pals, do some people watching and try to solve the world's problems without breaking the budget.  My buddy Thel turned me on to this place, and it's worth my first shout-out on Yelp.
author: Renner V.

description:
Being a true yelp-believer, I researched and listed highly rated North Beach restaurants prior to walking the Barbary Coast Trail. We got as far as Coit Tower before the hunger pains hit, we were drunk, dehydrated  and tired. 901 Columbus Cafe happened to be the closest spot on the list. Yelp rarely disappoints.

They had a variety of vegetarian sandwiches and wraps. I got the DiMaggio, a vegan wrap with falafel, pickles, hot sauce, veggies and grilled to crunchy perfection. One bite into it and I was in food heaven. My friend had the Sinatra and seemed satisfied with it. 

Friendly service, great food and nice atmosphere. Too bad there isn't anything similar in Santa Clara.
author: Tif W.

description:
Great place to sit and write Yelp reviews... :-)  Not too noisy--comfy couches and a TV usually tuned to some kind of sporting event.

Pastrami Melt was delicious a few days ago and the guy that handed it to me was cute to boot. 

I'm actually sitting here right now contemplating my lunch and can't decide because everything looks delicious.
author: Krystha B.

description: $2 firestone beer on draft. No need to say more.
author: Mauricio S.

description: I went to 901 Columbus Caffe for a quick dinner before class and it was okay. I had a good vegetarian wrap which took about 10 minutes to make even though there were only a few people there and no one else had ordered food. There is a lot of seating and free wi-fi which is nice. The music is pretty loud which makes it a little hard to study. Cash only.
author: Gina C.

description:
If you like the feel of a local coffee shop coupled with great coffee, excellent sandwiches and free WIFI, look no further.

I had the breakfast burrito with eggs, spinach, cheese and bacon. This thing was grilled on a panini press and was served piping hot. Okay I'm hungry again. 

The coffee was also exceptional - I opted for the regular instead of the flavored. Since that is usually my preference, I hold high standards for the flavor of the actual bean (no hazelnut to drown out a sub-par bean). This one passes the test with flying colors.

One thing worth noting is that there is a $5 minimum purchase for credit cards.

We will definitely return when we visit SF again!
author: Chris R.

description:
Good food and coffee, tainted somewhat by the usually loud bad music.

Great nighttime happy hour.
author: Alex N.

description: Totally average coffee shop. Maybe during happy hour the ratings are kicked up, but my lunch panini & cappuccino experience was pretty blasé. No way would I give this 5 stars.
author: Tom S.

description:
I've been here several times, especially when I lived in NB. I love 901's waffles and paninis. They are delicious! I also dig the environment. It's mellow, yet helps get the juices flowing if you need to do some serious work. The people are pretty nice here and 901 draws a good crowd. 

One Sunday morning, my bf and I were earnestly looking for a place to eat some food, have coffee and just enjoy a nice Sunday breakfast. After looking for parking for what seemed like FOREVER, we walked up to this restaurant packed with patrons. Without time to kill, we left. 901 was across the street so we went there. They definitely helped resolved our hungry bellies and my thirst for caffeine. 

I have yet to go there for happy hour but I can only imagine it's a chill spot to have a couple of beers and chat with friends. 

Good stuff. Two thumbs up!
author: Dorothea G.

description:
Best happy hour in San Francisco in my opinion.  $1.50 drafts... yes, only $1.50 for a pint of ice-cold beer!  Can you believe it... $1.50?!?!  Happy Hour is 5pm - 10pm, any day which means WEEKENDS, too!

It's not a bar, obviously, it's a cafe.  Actually, it's called 901 Columbus Caffe (two "ff"s), not to be confused with one of my favorite bars in North Beach, Columbus Cafe.  Food including soup, salad, and sandwiches; and drinks like caffeinated drinks and $1.50 draft beers!  There's also some really good looking desserts like home-made tiramisu, various cheesecakes, biscotti, and other sweet treats!  Big, flat screen television showing sports and lots of board games to play with -- my boyfriend, Ian and I played a great game of Scrabble the last time we were here.  It was so much fun.  

Great casual atmosphere, lots of people on their laptops taking advantage of the free wi-fi.  Outside seating also available during those hot San Francisco nights -- great for people watching (tourist and locals walking by or on the cable car, and looking at the Bikram students keepin' it hot doing yoga across the street).  

Will keep comin' back for more... more beer, off course.  Now for the catch... there's only 3 beers on-tap, only one the last time we were there, but it was still worth it because I cannot think of a better way to spend my $1.50 :-)!
author: Celeste M.

description:
I have a love/hate relationship with this place and right now I'm on the hate side of things... well, hate is a bit too aggressive.  Maybe just the not-good side.  

The service is pretty awful compared to other coffee shops in the neighborhood and i get the feeling that the guys behind the counter couldn't care less if you were there or not.  Not a big deal usually but annoying when there is no line and you are still waiting to place your order.   

I do like the atmosphere otherwise.  The beer is cheap, the coffee is good enough, and even the tiramisu is pretty good.  Not a bad option but for now im headed to other coffee shops.
author: John S.

description: I wish they had more places like this in southern cali. This place is awesome. Great service, great prices, great food! I had no idea what to order, had very little cash & was trying to feed 6 people haha. I wasn't expecting much, but the guy taking my order was really patient with me and very helpful. When I took the food back to our hotel, everyone loved em! I wish we could have tried everything else on the menu mmm...
author: Keith O.

description:
I spent a considerable amount of time at this cafe during my trip. My friend had to work on some freelance writing so I put in a decent amount of reading time. I liked how relaxed it feels here - the staff is friendly and you don't feel like you have to rush to finish. It's a great place to get some work done or just spend some alone time if you want to graze and read. 

I was pleasantly surprised by my "Crunchy Tuna" sandwich. I usually don't order tuna sammies because they're always so mayo heavy and soggy but this one was just right and loaded with veggies.  The second time I was there I had a bagel with lox. It wasn't as good as the tuna sandwich but I think it's because I'm admittedly a bit of a bagel snob. I can't lie - I think bagels are better in New York. 

I'm sad to say I didn't have any of the buck fifty drafts.... next time.
author: Alli J.

description: 901 Columbus is great.  I come here all the time.  The staff is friendly and makes you feel right at home.  The coffee as well as food is delicious (try the falafel).   What is remarkable is how they have made it into a fantastic place to work during the day (very fast internet, low music volume) but also a really cool place to hang out with friends during the evening ($2 beers!).  My favorite cafe in North Beach.
author: Sean M.

description:
Came here on a lazy Saturday afternoon.  Needed a quick lunch, so I walked down the block and into this local cafe.

The interior's very cozy, with a large tv, benches, and outlets everywhere.  Plenty of folks just hanging out with a book, or a laptop... or a few friends.

I had the pesto chicken panini, and it was delicious!  A pretty big portion, and was surpirsed I inhaled the whole thing.  It was that good.

My roommate came here for breakfast and mentioned the blueberry waffles being superb.

I haven't been here for happy hour yet, but I do the see a decent size crowd forming when I walk by at night.
author: Maggie L.

description:
I don't think you can find Speakeasy for $2 a pint in many places.  I'm staring at a tap with Prohibition, White Lightning, and Big Daddy.  

The food is decent, but nothing to write home about.  The coffee is okay, but ~ shots are not double ~.  

They gets five stars because they do a couple of things really well though.  The ambiance is really chill, they have free wifi, outlets, and good, cheap beer.
author: Chris J.

description: The draft beers are quite good and the happy hour is very reasonable in cost. The cookies have been good sometimes and just so so other times. In general the food is good, but slightly overpriced. The espresso is good, but the coffee has not always been the best. I've had it a few times when it was luke warm and kind of burnt tasting. This place is a good place to study in the day time, large tables and plugs for your laptops.
author: Joy H.

description:
Love this place. It's near where I live so most mornings I'm camped out there with my laptop eating one of their killer waffles and surfing the web with a cup of coffee in hand. The people are friendly and the food is good too (try their Pastrami sandwich for lunch), and if you're a laptop using fiend like me, don't worry....they'll never look at you funny or pressure you to leave.

I haven't been there for the $1.50 drafts like other Yelpers have mentioned, but I HAVE been there when the crazy old Chinese guy waltzes in, does a figure eight  around a couple of tables for no apparent reason, and then leaves. Which is, like, basically every time I've been there...
author: David H.

description: This place is fantastic, there was plenty of room and tables, with free wi-fi. The food is ridiculously tasty, and the owners were extremely friendly. Plus they have a really good happy hour. and this cappuccino us treating me quiet well this morning.
author: Angus P.

description: Great service, atmosphere. Had two sandwiches with a friend - solid.
author: Danica F.

description: Free wi-fi, delicious coffee drinks, pastries and CNN on the flat screen TV plus fun people watching (tourists scrambling to get on the cable cars).
author: Johanna S.

description:
This is my favorite coffee shop in the city -- it wins best ALL-AROUND.

The food = excellent.
The staff = friendly.
The coffee = delicious.
The prices = fair.
The internet = FREE

Try it!
K, thanks.
author: M J.

description:
The recipe for a five star cafe:

- A delicious menu that can keep me all day. Start me off with a distinctive breakfast, follow that with a vast array of sandwiches and finish it off with an afternoon parfait snack. 901 Columbus delivered on each one - an excellent belgium waffle, a very satisfying turkey on ciabatta (bonus points for not charging to swap mayo for hummus) and a generously sized strawberry filled parfait. And don't forget the coffee with sugar free syrups - 901 has that covered as well.

- Free internet and plenty of outlets. Done and done at 901 Columbus. Too bad I was using it mainly for work.

- Friendly and attentive service. Loved how the guys working the counter let me open a tab. I was never rushed, totally could have been there open to close and no one would have cared.

Next time I might.
author: Jason B.

description: Love the salami & avocado sandwich on toasted Italian bread... the basil adds a wonderful twist of flavor.  Their tiramisu is small, but moist, with just the right amount of cream & ladyfingers.
author: May L.

description: LOVE this place. Decent food, excellent happy hour special, super friendly staff, WiFi, board games, TV....just a great place to hang out with a small group or by yourself without feeling creepy.
author: Sarah B.

description: Hands down my favorite cafe. Great for families. Very welcoming and attentive. The Zebra is a knock-out coffee drink, as good as anything in North Beach. Highly recommended.
author: tegen d.

description:
I'm hesitant to write a review in fear that I won't have a seat next time I go over.   I simply ask that if you, attractive yelp user, decide to show up here based upon my review, that you offer me the open space next to you.

Just discovered this place - and it is EXACTLY what I want in my neighborhood.

1) A coffee shop open later than all the other ones!
2) The option to switch from coffee to Beer!
3) A wide range of food that suits coffee breaks, snacks, and meals.  The panini I had was pretty decent.  I hope to try more things.  
4) Free WiFi without the annoying Starbucks sign-in BS 
5) Great atmosphere. Comfortable, spacious, and relaxing.

Update:

I come here A LOT.  

The owners are very friendly, and you can't beat $2 beers.  Seriously.
author: Stryrker S.

description:
I like this place because it has wi-fi internet, the service is really nice and very down to earth. There a lot of different things to eat and drink while you hang out there for a few hours and they don't care. The place is warm when it's color outside instead of most places that don't want to spend the money on the heat bill. It just goes to show that this place, that sells some pretty good vanilla latttes, cares about the customer first.

That's just the vibe I get.
author: Katherine F.

description: 901 Columbus Cafe is a good place for a bite and beverage before or after hiking Lombard Street. Small corner building with limited indoor and outdoor seating, free Wi-Fi and some quality fare. Service was a little slow due to a lower staffing level.
author: Jay M.

description: I've never before been accosted for using the bathroom. I've gotten my morning coffee here on several occasions. This morning... after walking several blocks... I really needed to use the bathroom. I had my laptop in tow... clearly intending to stay. but as i entered the bathroom i was dragged out and asked to purchase something first. the man behind the counter was then quite rude and unsmiling as if he didnt want to serve me. not coming back .
author: Sarah A.

description: This is your cafe - look no further if you find yourself wandering in north beach. Fresh homemade sandwiches, pastries, cakes, and locally roasted bean. Plenty of sitting space and wonderful people watching (it has the corner of columbus and lombard to itself after all). And let us not forget, $2 drafts from 5pm until close.
author: Alex B.

description:
I'll start out with the positive. The atmosphere is great and it's a local find. 
The negative just relate to the short hispanic worker that works at the cash register.  We walked in and before we could load our laptops up, we were told that we had to leave because the internet was for customers only and that we had a time limit to leave.  Then we purchased a bottled drink and after we paid he told us the cafe was closing in a couple minutes.  When we asked for the money back since the cafe was closing soon, he said that he could not give us our cash back because he already gave us the change.  All he had to do was give us the couple dollars we gave him, in return for the closed bottle drink that was still on the counter.  I would love to speak to this employees manager.
author: Brooke Y.

description:
This place is awesome. Cozy, inviting, warm, diverse. The food is excellent and better than you would expect. Breakfast burritos are super yum. Try the bacon, egg and cheese. It's big. Their lattes are great and they have these amazing aromatic waffles that beg to be ordered. The chocolate one has poof of cream and the blueberry one takes my vote for favorite. 

And what's better than $1.50 drafts! Save up your laundry money and spend it all here! Outdoor seating has made it more of a chill place in the evenings where people smoke butts and have what I'd imagine to be life-changing conversation. 

Staff is real nice, unlike another reviews suggests. Believe that. I go here often, too. Place gets crammed though from the tourist rush, so don't get cranky if you have to wait. Peace.
author: n b.

description:
First of all they were AMAZINGLY rude.  Get in line WAY before 10:00, watch as the super super super slow staff acts all bitching and snotty and SLOOOOOOOOW, and get up to the front of the line right in time for the guy to say, "Oh sorry, we JUST stopped serving because it's 9:50:14, despite our LYING sign outside that proclaims beer until 10:00, because, you see, we love to lie, we are liars and such.  It's just who we are.  Liars.  Child molesting liars.  We can't help it.  It's just how we roll, you know.  Yep, molesting children and lying, the two best things ever, other than pissing in our customer's drinks, of course.  Oh, and we are gonna be douche bags and pretend that last call was 14 seconds ago.  Oh and by the way, I'm a total dick, don't ever give me a tip or visit my establishment.  That goes for ALL of us who work here.  In fact, not only don't even tip us, intentionally spill any sort of foul smelling difficult to clean up thing that you can on your way out.  We appreciate the extra work since we are COMPLETE ASSHATS."  

I'm paraphrasing, of course.
author: Mason G.

description:
$2 beers and board games???? YES! they have both.... 

Great place to hang out with friends and drink a couple of beers, coffee or just chill. 

The food is also great! The tuna special is MOUTH WATERING kinda want one right now just thinking about it. Great little spot!
author: Ka C.

description: Stopped in shortly today while waiting to get let in for Freaks and Geeks next door at Cobb's and ordered a Mocha Latte. He made it right there for me without making me wait elsewhere. It was reasonably priced and delicious.
author: Jaimie R.

description: The baristas know what they are doing at this convenient location on Columbus. The coffee is good, and the cafe style food is great too. I stop by occasionally and enjoy the 2 dollar pint night.
author: Chris S.

description: This place is amazing.  They make a great cappuccino and the sandwiches are pretty good.  It's a nice place to study and they have free wifi so bring the laptop.  Check it out.
author: Allison P.

description: You will find me sitting at a table outside of 901 pretty much whenever the weather and my schedule premits... There are a host of reasons to come here; the least of which is that it's two blocks from my home. They have an excellent beer special everyday from 5pm-10pm, $1.50 for Speakeasy, Becks or Windermere hefeweizen. Their food is a nice selection of wraps, salads and both hot and cold sandwiches really tasty and they always have super fresh veggies.  Also the owner "T" is a really nice and friendly guy that cares about his establishment and seems to genuienly want people to enjoy their time there.
author: Thel D.

description: Ridiculous happy hour beer specials, and just an overall chill vibe; great place to relax.
author: Mark A.

description: This is a great cafe so my only sour note is that it closes at 7 p.m.  What I like about this cafe is that there are a lot of plugs for laptop work.  They also have computers if you don't have your own.  They have an assortment of comfy seating (couch, love seat and stuffed bench) and traditional work seating (wooden tables and chairs).  Their Zebra Mocha is yummy.  They have a big screen t.v. if you'd rather watch t.v.  They offer real food if you crave non-pastries.  Service is fantastic (T and his team are major sweeties).  In fact, they took care of my one time complaint of insufficient caffeine high by customizing my coffee order for me.
author: Caitlyn K.

description: As I sit here, starring at my lap top reading  a review about people starring at their laptops wasting there day, I ordered another $2 dollar beer and didn't really care.  The beer is good too.  Nice hoppy taste, mouth waters for more...
author: Greg Y.

description: New to North Beach from the panhandle--on the quest for a local cafe to hang. Planned on writing my xmas cards and having a glass of wine and stumbled upon Monday movie night, nice since I don't have tv or cable (gasp) at my new place. Good food and I think the menu said happy hour every day from 5-10?!? or maybe my eyes deceived me. Good soup and nice crowd, think I will be hanging out there to people watch and relax on the couch with a good book.
author: Laurie K.

description: Great coffee, comfy seats, free wifi, smiling friendly staff: the recipe is simple and this place gets it just right. If you need to take a break and chill out in North Beach, try 901 Columbus.
author: chewie33

description: ugh, went here in my lunch break today. service was terrible. I ordered the #41 to go, which was just spinach, feta cheese and pineapple, with a dijon dressing. it was terrible. i waited 20mins for this salad, and when i opened it up there was no dressing and hardly any feta. seriously 20minutes in a nearly empty place for this?!  i also noticed the girl behind the counter, in the green dress and white shirt, who was making food, without gloves, with her hands all in her hair. yuck. never coming back.
author: Allen H.

description: Awesome place. Comfy seating, clean, tons of outlets (hint: look behind the bench seats along the wall -- that escaped me for a few minutes until I saw the girl behind me plug in), friendly service. Feels much more like a neighborhood joint than a lot of the other places I've frequented in North Beach. Good coffee and free wifi means I'll be back.
author: Allison L.

description:
i can't believe i have been going to school for two years down the street from this place and i just discovered it a few weeks ago. i feel like everything i have tried here is good. good smoothies, excellent vegetarian sandwiches with a variety of options like feta cheese and basil, avocado and sprouts, you name it. the servers are nice too. one stopped me on the street and said hi! (i might have a small crush on one guy who works here, shhhh)

edit: i went there today and had my first bad experience. i ordered a bodega on wheat bread and one server totally forgot to give it to me. i was sitting right there the whole time. 
:( maybe i'll get something for free next time, you know, after my boycott.
author: Oleya P.

description:
I was looking for a place to lunch when I bumped into this cosy place. What I like is that it's a little out of the touristic area's, so it's not too crowded. When I was there (2PM on a Saturday) there were some people doing some work on their laptop with the free wifi, some people reading a book, and others were watching the Italian soccer match on tv: just a great relaxing atmosphere.

I ordered a sandwich with a cup of tea, and both tasted great. Especially the tuna sandwich was fresh and delicious. The staff was friendly, the music blends into the space and it's just a nice place to hang out or do some work.
author: Frank d.

description: It's a fine neighborhood cafe for coffee and doing homework.  But I wasn't impressed with the breakfast or the service.
author: Jess S.

description: Great place, try the zebra mocha. Free wifi is always nice plus outlets to charge up.
author: stephen j.

description: Nice location, delicious paninis, and decent tiramisu. Prices were ok. We weren't able to stay for happy hour, but I bet that would have bumped me up to a 5- main reason we're staying at a 4 is that the women's bathroom smelled awful and was sort of dirty.
author: Rika Y.

description: I was wandering north through San Francisco on foot for a long time -- I finally stumbled into 901 Columbus Caffe when I heard Belle & Sebastian playing and went for an iced chai.  A great place to spend an afternoon with a laptop, chatting with friends, etc.  And I had a delicious onion bagel with cream cheese, tomato, and basil.  Mmmmmm...
author: Moku D.

description: The coffee is great, the outside tables have sun for most of the day and the owner is almost always there making sure that things run smoothly. The food is good and they also have beer on tap. Sometimes it gets a bit crowded with tourists headed up Lombard Street, try it on a weekday.
author: Katherine C.

description: YES!  My second 5 star on Yelp.  901 is an amazing little corner cafe.  The staff is really cool and the food is delicious...so good.  Last time I had the Wiseguy and it was one of the best things I've eaten while here in San Francisco.  Prices are good and they also have a nice selection of beer in the fridge.  It's right next to my apartment and has a great atmosphere, so you'll definitely be able to find me here more often.
author: Nate V.

description: Just moved to the neighborhood and looking for a regular "go-to" spot near by. Happened in on this place because of the $2 beer sign outside. Had a salad, which was great and very huge. Also, there's a few outdoor tables, which is a huge plus. I'd say though that the food is a little overpriced (though it's really made up in what you pay for beer) and that it's a little dark and cluttered inside. But all in all, this is definitely a contender for my usual spot.
author: Emily F.

description: I work next door so I'm in here a lot. I'm a big fan of the salads, sandwiches, cookies (if they're fresh out of the oven which they often are), and the zebra mocha. Days if I get out of work the $1.50 beers from 5-10 make any evening more bearable.
author: Constance C.

description: This cafe has a long list of foods. I order either something to eat or drink and I'm never disappointed. The locals hang out there, and the tourist stop for a meal. This is a great place to eat.
author: Manuel N.

description: A great spot:  comfortable, clean, wireless.  Friendly, laid back atmosphere.  Great tasting coffee.
author: Sal M.

description:
three star smoothies and 4 star bagels.
and the guy runnin the joint was just such a sweetheart.
love all the chairs outside with the happy lil couples soakin up some sun.
i'm doin that next time I'm there.
author: Jeremi M.

description: The place sits in a great location and has outdoor seating. Everyone who works there is super nice, probably because the owner, T, knows how to keep them happy. A big TV where you can catch a soccer game during the afternoon. They have a scanner too, just in case. Beers are 1.50 after 5, doesn't really get any better in North Beach. A great SF spot!
author: Zhenya S.

description: I had two surprisingly negative experiences with two different cashiers today.  First, when I was charged $3.50 for a bottle of water, I told the cashier it was too much and he told me that if I didn't like it, I could go across the street to the liquor store and buy a bottle of water that was cheaper.  I then ordered a bowel of soup that was 80% broth.  When I complained about it, the cashier told me that that's the way that their soup was, he took the bowel back from me and gave me my money back.  I asked to get the contact information of the manager, and the employees wouldn't give it to me.  Later, the manager came in and I told him what happened.  He told me he would be happy to treat me to their tiramisu to make up for my troubles.  I told him that I didn't want any tiramisu.  He asked me what would make up for my experience.  I told him, that if I was him, I would offer to comp the salad and water that I  had paid for because I had such a negative customer service experience.  He refused.  I told him that I would write a yelp review and he told me to go ahead.  With so many different cafes in N. Beach, how can an establishment afford to treat its customers like this?  I know that I'll make sure to choose one of the other 50 alternatives in a 10 block radius next time.
author: Kate H.

description:
We chose this cafe one afternoon because it was the midway point btwn our house and the hotel where our friends (country mice freed from their children for the day) were staying.
We had coffee, bagels and biscotti and it was all delicious.
I loved our Lodi bagel; feta cheese, tomatoes, basil and olive oil. Nummers!
I hope we have an excuse to come here again because their whole menu looked oh so good!
author: A W.

description:
this place would be a perfect location for a starbucks. i don't think there is one within 2 blocks so whats the deal? ;)

i sit and write chez 901 as a host of locals and tourons alike alight to imbibe and nourish. a little girl with her own mini stroller just walked out the door with her prego mommy. there is a horror flick on the flatscreen and a hot curly haired girl banging away on her black mac. the wait staff is super friendly and the pastrami sandy i had yesterday was terrific. 

so what's it all about? i feel dry bowled creatively since our latest investor prospect decided to make us look stupid but i will say that this is a good lower no. beach hang. free wireless and though the occasional busload of chinese tourons descends, its never too crowded to find a spot to work. 

so eat heavy...
author: tommy p.

description: This is my spot, my jam, my homie.  I love love love the coffee, it is amazing.  The people that own it, and work there are so great, and they really care about the neighborhood.  This is the type of buisness people want to have in their hood!
author: Rachel P.

description: If I'm in North Beach it's my default coffee shop. I will try new places as the urge strikes me, but if I need somewhere to be for a while this is a good choice. Open wireless and available outlets mean I can take my laptop and relax. Staff has always been attentive, polite, and interesting, moreso in all categories than I generally expect at a coffee shop.
author: Brian S.

description: I used to live across the street from this place and I miss it dearly. Fresh food, great coffee, and very nice owners. It was like my version of Central Perk. Seriously. Couldn't walk by without popping inside. I miss you 901!
author: Cat S.

description: Words cannot express how great 901 is.  The staff is friendly and remembers you by name.  The food is high quality and consistently great.  The coffee is excellent.  AND now they serve beer for $1.50 til 10:00 pm!!!
author: gaby g.

description: Awesome spot for working.  Good food, reliable internet, tho not a whole lot of outlets.  Friendly service, TV inside a bit noisy, but cheap beers, fair amount of space.
author: Eric W.

description: Great service, free wi-fi, good music, outstanding coffee, really good bagels. What more can you ask?
author: Kyle H.

description: Strolled in here after spening 4 hours exploring russian hill on foot. Peckish for a panini, I ordere a pastrami one and it satisfied my expectations indeed. The cappuccino was the best I've tried even beats blue bottle... this place commands the repeat of a visit.
author: isis n.

description: If this place had beds, I'd move in. :-D $1.50 Big Daddy IPAs make me happy.
author: Cameron K.

description: They're open later! Yay! And the schwerma is still great- that chili sauce & yoghurt hits home. Also- the happy hour deal is unreal, as other yelpers attest.
author: Anna B.

description: Great local cafe for a quick bite or a ridiculously good deal on beer - $1.50 drafts from 5-10pm everyday! Good not great  food but a much better option than the neighboring cafe. Don't expect glowing service though unless you're wearing skinny jeans and give off that "I hate my dad vibe."
author: Justin O.

description: I come here many weekends for breakfast and coffee. For breakfast I usually get the yogurt granola parfait, a waffle, or a bagel sandwich. All hit the spot. Prepare to wait a while for your breakfast/lunch on the weekends since they get pretty busy and don't have much help in the kitchen area. There is a good seating area with free wifi inside, and also seating outside for warm days.
author: Laura W.

description: great atmosphere for watching a baseball game. loved their firestone beer. the al copone sandwich was tasty.
author: George I.

description:
Columbus Caffe rules.  When I first moved here I was there pretty much everyday looking for a job and place to live.  Got lunch there, had coffee there, drank a beer there.  Its a cool place.

The employees are pretty cool as well.  I shall not forget Columbus Caffe....
author: Richard C.

description: Love the neighborhoody vibe, the board games, the comfy couches. Great waffles- banana pecan and strawberry chocolate chip were delicious! Tasty smoothies and fruit juices. I had something called Cubana or something; watermelon and lime juices fresh squeezed and blended- the perfect drink on a summer day
author: Jay B.

description: That's pretty much where I go for coffee when I walk out of my house.  Great coffee!  Can't really comment on the food as I hardly eat there. But the interiors and the outdoor area could use some serious updating and beautification (please, please, please).  I would love to buy the coffee from then and then go and sit at one of their neighbors outdoor table at Caffe Sapore (don't care for their coffee).  I am glad they finally put some planters out there.  It's a first step. Thank you! The staff/service is so-so unless the owner serves you.  He is super nice and friendly and always smiles.
author: Manuela P.

description: This place is great.  Awesome atmosphere, its warm, and comfortable. Has great coffee and food.  Enjoy a coffee in the morn and guzzle a beer in the late afternoon!
author: Laura J.

description: 901 Columbus serves a variety of panini on foccacia bread and each one is spicy... exactly the way I like it.  I also had minestrone soup, which tasted fine, and italian soda.  Unfortunately the selection of syrup flavors for the soda is a bit small, but that just pushed me to be more adventurous and try something outside my usual strawberry-kiwi order.  Service is great; the waiter keeps an ironic playfulness about himself.  He was also more than happy to give my partner tips on how to drink her italian soda, as it was her first time.  The TV was playing The Never-Ending Story with captions.
author: Tim M.

description: This place is the Cheers of San Francisco..... complete with the group of "intellectuals" who enjoy most of their day at 901 Columbus. It even has an owner / proprietor like Sam.... that would be Tarek.... or "T" for short.  He and his mother run the place and they are both wonderful people. The food is honest and fresh. The beer is CHEAP... but a great local brew. The coffee is superb and I believe custom crafted for 901 Columbus. My only complaint is that I can't spend my entire day here. I also think Tarek should open another business that has a full bar and kitchen. I can't wait to see what he could do with that!
author: Andrew C.

description: The sandwiches here are delicious and a great deal for the money. They average $7-9 and are pretty big. The atmosphere is great for just kicking back or getting some work done. It kind of feels like a cafe fused with a bar. There's free wi-fi and $1.50 draft beers from 5-10pm everyday. With both outside and indoor seating, you can really make this place work for any situation. Service is friendly, although you can expect to wait 5-10 minutes for your sandwich. But boy, is it worth the wait. Paninis, wraps, whatever you choose - they're all wonderfully delicious. Plenty of vegetarian options, too.
author: Willy C.

description: I was recently laid off from my job, so I have been on a quest to find cozy cafes to spend my days searching for jobs.  Columbus Cafe is near my home, so I thought that would be a great place to start.  Internet is free, coffee is good, and it's a great spot for people watching. You can choose to sit outside or you can cozy up in a chair or couch on the inside.  I only had the fruit and coffee, but there was a wide array of menu items to choose from. I would definitely recommend this spot if you want a quick bite to eat or want to curl up with a good book.
author: Shawna H.
