description: 901 Columbus is a great neighborhood cafe with distinctive and tasty sandwiches, friendly help behind the counter, free wireless internet, and (of course) good coffee.  What more does a digital nomad need?
author: Robert P.

description: Free Wi-Fi. Super friendly staff. Great coffee and tea drinks (my wife drinks the coffee and I drink the tea). And, some nice little food dishes. Plus, they have a beer and wine license, so it's a great little spot to have a business meeting and have all the options available.
author: Bryan B.

description: I really like this place.  The people are friendly, the sandwiches are good, the atmosphere is cool, the wifi is great, and the latte's are fab.  I will be coming back again and again.  The only thing that gets old are the tour buses that stop out front and unload mobs of tourists that make their way up to the curvy part of Lombard... but that is just a function of being in North Beach and has nothing to do w/ 901.  Great spot.
author: ardian b.

description: I like this place.  It is laid back, warm and cozy inside.  A great place to sit and have coffee or the occasional snack.  Very comfortable.  I have tried several bagels from the menu.  All have been good.  The baristas seem to remember you and have always been nice.  I get a latte and have never been disappointed.
author: Robert A.

description: Love this place. Great environment, good food, the best Chai I've had in SF, and the $2 draft beers are a great way to transition away from a workday. Friendly staff and a few choice seats round out a great caffe.
author: Eric D.

description: This place was awesome. The paninis were good, they serve beer, are a decent price and it has a cozy atmosphere. I can't wait to go back.
author: Vesna S.

description: I live in the neighborhood and have never gone here before today.  My boyfriend and I loved it!  It was a super great value, friendly service and delicious food.  We'll be back for the great happy hour- two buck drafts and three dollar house wine.
author: Stacy P.

description: Found this place for lunch via Yelp.  The sandwich I had was delicious.  The people there were friendly.  The atmosphere was pretty laid back - a few people working on computers, and there might have been someone reading at one of the tables.  It felt like a great place to study/work for a while if you're looking for a place for that.  If you're just looking for a good place for lunch, then this would be your place, too.  I'd likely go back frequently if I lived in the area.
author: W Y.

description: By far the best Cafe I have been to in North Beach! It is family owned and you can often find the cute little mom running around working just like the other employees. They have free wi-fi, a happy hour that will rock your world $2 beers and $3 wines.-all night. This place is so relaxed and chill and you can just sit here and mingle with the other people here or get lost in a good book. The food is amazing for cafe food and you can totally tell everything they use is fresh. The employees are nice and actually like helping definitely recommended
author: Cleo H.

description: when i first moved to this city, i would go here so often that two of the guys behind the counter would already recognize me and smile.  it's the kind of place where i walk in with my headphones and take them off because the music is always on point.  the chais are delicious and the sandwiches are light and delicious.  $1.50 draft happy hour?  AND... they just extended their hours from 7pm to 10pm, which had always been a wish of mine.  cozy ambiance, super friendly staff, good food, coffee, chais and beers... and all pretty cheap..?  come on dude, how can you lose?  i LOVE this place.
author: Beccie F.

description: I write this review as I enjoy a stupendous latte and wonderful peanut butter cookie.  The service was prompt and very friendly.  The atmosphere is comfortable and relaxed. I'm only in San Francisco for a few days, but I plan on visiting here several more times.
author: Jason G.

description: Possibly the best atmosphere in North Beach, but with the worst coffee. They could serve instant coffee, though, and I would still come here every day. It feels like a living room, with a couch and a tv, and the staff here is awesome and sweet. Order a cappuchino or a zebra mocha instead, which are both great.
author: J S.
